review_title: Very hateful for all the worst reasons
review_detailed_main:
JACK AND JILL has quite a notorious reputation achieved through all these years. It won the most Razzie Awards a movie has ever received (including the one for both worst actor and worst actress for Adam Sandler), here it has 3,2 and it's currently #48 in the infamous Bottom 100. These reasons alone bought me to finally sit through this movie some months ago, and unfortunately, I had to agree with almost all the haters.

Jack Sadelstein (Sandler) is a publicist that one day has the chance of having his big break if he hires Al Pacino for appearing in a new commercial about a new brand of Cappuccino named Dunkacino (pun intended). Unfortunately, it's the Thanksgiving period and Jack's sister Jill (again Sandler) comes for staying at his home for a few days, and she is anything than subtle! What follows is exactly lots of pointless scenarios including Al Pacino that has an infatuation for Jill, Jack's bum friends that come to his dinner and so on and so forth.

I wanted to give JACK AND JILL a chance, but as it progressed, I thought the level of intelligence in my brain was lowering. The humour was very flat, it never made me laugh not even once and I waited 90 minutes for that ONE joke that probably could have saved this movie, but it never came. The acting is awful: Adam Sandler has made some great comedies including even some of his straight to Netflix ones, but he has never been annoying here as both Jack and Jill! Al Pacino and Katie Holmes look like they are here just for the paycheck, while David Spade and Shaquille O'Neal in tiny pointless cameos? They were right in their element! Only the cinematography and soundtrack were good, but at times the editing felt very rushed.

In substance, a cult classic of bad movies that should be seen at least once just for saying that there has never been anything like it before. Clearly this movie deserves to be in the halloweed Bottom 100 of IMDB.

Welcome back to another edition of Adam's Reviews!! **queue in intro music**

Today's movie review is the comedy Jack and Jill (2011) where the Sandman plays an advertising executive and his annoying twin sister - yep that's right one of those Van Damme twin flicks. But this is no Van Damme flick. It is a terrible movie. Fart jokes galore and a joke on Atheism people. We do have Sir Al Pacino...why did he make this film playing himself falling in love with Sandler's twin sister character? Like he actually plays a caricature of himself as an oddball who speaks gibberish in order to fool people that he can speak other languages and becomes attracted to Jill due to her being brought up in the Bronx. Other than that, you see him singing and dancing to a Dunkin' Donut ad campaign, which he gives his utmost energetic performance. This movie as Pacino says in the end needs to be burnt. Overall, 2/10
I really do love Adam Sandler. I grew up listening to his albums and really enjoyed his early movies. I even liked some of his dramatic roles. But this thing is just bad. Painfully so.
Pure escapism. No politics, no hate, no message. Just pure hilarity!

review_title: Ignore the bad reviews - it's got quite a few laughs plus Al Pacino
review_detailed_main:
I read the bad reviews about how annoying it was but it wasn't annoying. The basic premise has potential - maybe Jill could have been funnier but there are quite a lot of laughs about siblings and twins. The writing doesn't have Farrelly Brothers originality and bite.

What you probably don't expect to get it Al Pacino in a major comical role as himself. That alone is worth watching. There is some toilet humor but no more than in Eddie Murphy comedies.

Adam Sandler doesn't try too hard to be a woman. The blending of the 2 in the same scene is quite good. Kate Holmes doesn't have a lot of lines - it could have been anyone in her role. The kids aren't memorable.

Overall don't expect too much and you'll be surprised there are some laughs from beginning to end. There are too many action movies out there so see it and support comedies instead.

review_title: Adam Sandler as a dude and Adam Sandler as a chick in a movie is godawful
God, Adam Sandler is so in love with himself! Why not just call the film Adam Sandler, Adam Sandler, Adam Sandler and Adam Sandler dresses and acts like an obnoxious troll?
Possibly the worst film ever made
review_detailed_main: Can I name 3 films which are worse than this one? How could Al Pacino be part of this? Was he blackmailed? How can I possibly watch this thing all the way to the end? Why do I now feel like I need to hurt someone? These are just some of the questions which come up while watching this film. Now I've seen Adam Sandler - so I thought I knew what I was in for. I actually quite like Happy Gilmore and a few of his others. Sure, being a little drunk helps make them better, but they're moderately watchable anyway. This one, however, is not. You would be better served watching "Snow Shark - Ancient Snow Beast" than this thing. OMFG - I fear this film may cause brain damage. Do NOT watch this film. It will take years off your life. I can't be any clearer.

review_title: Adam Sandler! ...This Time, With R-Rated Fart Jokes in a PG-13 Movie ....
review_detailed_main:
Can you always get the best results with the best ingredients? The answer is YES, YOU CAN. Provided you have an actor/superstar who listens to his director, an actress/global celebrity who just glows on screen throughout the movie and if the big budget is totally justified.

All the credit for this extravagant movie goes to Sandler. The man is an absolute genius. His creativity reaches great heights with this movie and elevates the American Hollywood movie standard to an all time high. With every movie of his, the scale of movie-making grows tremendously. He got the best technology money can buy. Looks like the majority of the budget is spent on Animatronics and this movie has got plenty of that.

Sandler is magnificent in this movie. In fact, he is the movie. He adds life to every single frame created by Sandler. Sandler does what he does best, looking GORGEOUS.He has some pretty slick dance moves too but these go unfeatured in this particular blockbuster.

The Animatronics are the best you could find in any movie so far and not just an American movie. The CGs are spectacular. Sandler shows the audience some of the best places in the world all for a few bucks. The locations are mind-blowing and totally unique to this movie. Sandler handpicked the locations for backdrops and they are shot on a grand scale. The music is haunting and highly entertaining.

This movie will surely become one of the biggest movies ever made in the US and without a doubt bring in a lot of moolah to the producers, distributors and the exhibitors all around the world.

Sandler redefines the fart gag. Truly, a legend of a man.

review_title: Mr Goofy and Mrs Loser did it again! Time to pack it up and retire!
review_detailed_main:
We went to Blockbuster to find something for the kids for the weekend - and just seeing Adam's face on a DVD cover makes me throw up even without any food in the stomach. However I had to give in as the kids picked this movie.

I watched it between the house chores and cleaning up after the Sunday dinner and sat down with a beer halfway through the movie. The kids looked dull and I had not heard any laughters yet - just to confirm that they made a bad choice.

Adam should get the #1 goofiest movie award and get out of Hollywood. Seriously all his movies are just nerdy and this time he is playing a double role of his "twin sister".

It's a shame that someone dragged in Al Pachino into this dumb and dull movie - such a great actor has really sunk low in his old days. Why on earth does he waste his time on such crap? Then we have loser #3; Katie Holmes. She is probably still trying to convince her husband that she still can act. Cute as she is, she does not need to waste her time in Hollywood with Tom's millions of dollars that he is throwing around. She should stay home and raise the kids. That Tom Cruise is still flushing out money to the Scientology sect is just a shame. One day he will wake up and find out that he wasted half his life and millions of dollars to support the cult leader David Miscavige who is living a luxury life on his accounts.

Katie! Last thing we heard in the gossip magazines was that you are leaving Tom because of Scientology? GOOD! Make him chose! Your acting might give you better roles and chances with him out of the picture.

This is a seriously dumb and dull movie. The kids didn't even enjoy it and next time I will remind them about Adam and his goofy escapades.

No wonder we never saw it in the theaters and it will probably also be very short lived in the RedBox stands. Barf!

review_title: Exactly what I needed on a Friday evening

review_detailed_main:
Wow, what a crock..... I am so sad that I wasted an hour plus of my life, when I had toilets to clean, ironing to do and there was a perfectly good episode of 'Neighbours' I could have watched.

Questions I have regarding this movie: 1: Did Katie really want to be out of the house that bad? 2: Did Al do something bad that Adam has a video or photos of? 3: Does Adam have some kind of problem with script reading staff? 4: How much extra Co2 has been needlessly added to the planet in production of plastics etc. used in the DVD/Bluray issue of this steaming pile?

Sorry Adam, this is an all time low, take a break, start reading the scripts, invest in quality not quantity. Get the 'Click' effect back into your movies.

Oh Adam I used to think you were funny . To see somebody evolve into such a sellout through the years . I literally almost vomited when I watched this garbage . If you feel like banging your head against the wall or pulling your own teeth by all means watch this um movie . Perhaps it is because I am not in the target audience for this **** anymore like 12 year old boy demographic .if you want a great Adam Sandler movie too watch check out wedding singer it's almost watchable.he has become a parody of the characters he portrays like the fish guy from funny people . I'm sure he could care a less with all the money he makes but that's it for me I'm out I will never watch anymore of his productions . .

Unlike many - and many who have posted negative reviews here, I am occasionally endeared to Adam Sandler. Therefore, I gave this film every chance - spurred on by seeing Al Pacino of course and Katie Holmes' radiant sweet face always helps.

However, after 40 minutes the delete button the recording I'd made from Sky Movies sent it where it should have been consigned, even before it was scripted.

Sandler, as the drag 'twin' has a voice that will send armies of rats across rivers and entire continents to escape his high-pitched wail. The comedy, such as it is is more obvious than obvious and never funny. They often jibe at ethnic and taboo subjects but never have the smartness or follow up to make them acceptable.

As for Pacino, well, I did get to see him, in a big heavy parka jacket and false beard. Jack, or was it Jill? makes a lazy connection with Osama Bin Laden and our Al removes said false beard and it's suddenly 'Hey, it' me!'. Yes, you can see what I mean.

Lazy, boring, annoying and a big big waste of talent. And time. Don't waste yours - avoid.

I really like Adam Sandler normally and I like light and silly comedy - comedy where you can just have an easy laugh. Happy Gilmore was enjoyable and Little Nicky made me laugh, so I thought "How bad can his latest flick possibly be?".

Well, the answer is: very bad. I'm sure there were supposed to be jokes in this movie but I failed to locate a single one - and so did the entire audience in the cinema, going by the utter silence filing the place (only disrupted by Jill squeaking on screen).

Positively not funny and not worth watching. Punching yourself in the face repeatedly is more fun than watching this and I really hope his next movie (should this one not end his career - it certainly has the potential to) will be better written and at least contain a couple of genuine jokes and funny bits.

review_title: Sandler proves his career really is in decline
review_detailed_main: There have been some okay Adam Sandler films in the past, such as The Wedding Singer and The Waterboy, and there have been some turkeys such as Little Nicky and Click. But this thing, Jack & Jill, is the worst by far. It's so bad you're left scratching your head and asking yourself two questions. 1) What were they thinking? and 2) Why did I come and see this? The film is boring, unfunny and stupid. Sandler co-wrote this and all that tells me is how he should never write again. If this is his idea of a good script for a comedy he clearly has lost the plot. It feels like it was written by a child. But even saying that would be an insult to children everywhere. This awful film has no redeeming qualities whatsoever. It's budget was a reputed $75m. They might as well have taken that money and set fire to it. This is an insult to writers and filmmakers everywhere.

review_title: Who told Sandler he was good as a woman?
review_detailed_main: How on earth was this film financed and put together? Does Sandler have that much clout in Hollywood? It was badly directed, badly lit and photographed and awkward to watch. D Dugan the director has to be responsible for letting Sandler make such a fool of himself. As for Pacino thats a complete mystery but he is clearly becoming a bigger egocentric as the years pass, his agent must carry some of the responsibility here. Adam Sandler is such a one trick pony (as are many of the so called comedy actors in Hollywood) Surely a revolution is just around the corner with strong original plot lines, passionate acting and a modicum of integrity as I feel we are being blatantly ripped off.

Jack and Jill Sadelstien are twins with very different lifestyles. While Jack is a wealthy commercial advertising director who runs his own company and has beautiful family with a gorgeous wife (Katie Holmes) Jill is a small town girl who grew up and lived with her mother all her life. Jill has not had any luck in her love life and is in some sorts quite clingy and needy and has very peculiar behavior patterns. Jacks largest client Dunkin Donuts is on the verge of a branding revamp and demands that Jack secure Al Pacino for the upcoming advertising campaign or they will cease all business with Jacks Company. Academy award winner Al Pacino does not do commercials! Meanwhile Jill visits Jack for the holidays and as usual is welcomed by the whole family except her own brother who find her disturbingly annoying. The story quite boringly rolls through until Jill happens to meet Al Pacino at a Lakers game and he falls in love with Jill head over heels.

Adam Sandler is a talented Hollywood celebrity who isn't afraid of taking risk with his movies. Maybe that is because it is said that irrespective of the success rate of the movie he is guaranteed a 20 million dollar paycheck for his appearance in a lead role. How true that is I do not know. Even for Sandler JACK & JILL is an all-time new low. Being married to Hollywood's main man Tom Cruise did not save Katie Holmes from this disaster. The script was horrible and what's worse Katie's acting is equally on par. Long gone are the days of her cute smile wins the hearts of viewers like in DAWSONS CREEK. I am still a huge fan and I adore her work, but this is one of the hardest movies I have sat through this summer. The after taste of how bad it is still lingers at its memory.

The only saving grace for JACK & JILL are the Nick Swardson appearances, he isn't all that great, but clearly if there is even one chuckle in the movie, it comes from him. It's surprising how Sandler didn't write one good line for him since the screen play is done by himself. The character of Jill can be assumed to have been the big comedy Dennis Dugan focused on. The joke ironically is on director Dugan himself. Sandler's portrayal of Jill is nothing but annoying, it isn't acting but more of shouting. In an attempt to differentiate the male from the female, Sandler stretches his voice a bit too much. Now I agree that there is a thin line between love and hate, JACK & JILL crosses that line! I simply loathe myself for wasting my time on even writing this down. Someone needs to warn you folks.

This being said, JACK & JILL won 10 awards overall for this production. Surprising? Not at all!!!!!! For those of you who are not familiar of the Golden Raspberry Awards, it is ceremony held to honor the worst movies of the year. JACK & JILL along with the cast set a record breaking high of securing 10 awards early this April.

Don't say I didn't warn you.

TITLE: JACK & JILL DIRECTED BY: DENNIS DUGAN STARRING: ADAM SANDLER, KATIE HOLMES, NICK SWARDSON, David SPADE, ROHAN CHAND, ELODIE TOUGNE and AL PACINO RATED: PG RATING: 02/10 91 MINUTES

There are movies (one of them being "Don't mess with the Zohan") that are so bad they're actually generating some kind of cult following because they're simply over-the-top. "Jack and Jill" is a very sad example of a movie being flat-out boring, unfunny and inspiring nothing but a bad overall feeling. Adam Sandler seems to have finally broken any connection with reality and positive criticism from his peers, and keeps on making supposedly funny movies when, in fact, all the fun has gone out of him. This ego trip that generates breaking the basic rule of comedies with guys in drag, rule that states that the audience is in on the joke, some of the characters in the movie are not, thus it creates a funny setup, is not observed by Sandler who is utterly unconvincing as a female character, being obviously Adam Sandler, and when the audience realizes that both the characters in the movie as well as the audience itself are the dumb ones that don't realize this character is obviously a guy in drag, then you get this extremely unpleasant vibe. What i felt bad about is that a couple of great actors joined this project, based, probably, on Sandler's reputation of creating those kind-of-stupid but funny movies. This one is the first I actually chose to watch, that I couldn't bear watching for more than thirty minutes, and it was a difficult time span. So disappointed...

I first wanted to watch this because I like Adam Sandler. When I checked out the rating, I REALLY wanted to watch it. A 3.3??? I have never seen such a low rating.

Well, I have NO idea why everyone dislikes this movie so much! It is one of those so stupid it's funny films. Adam Sandler did a great job playing his twin.

Not sure if people who rated this know who Adam Sandler even is?!?

I want to watch this movie again because it was great!

Don't let the ratings fool you or influence your opinion.

Trust me - you will either love it or hate it; there seems to be no in between. I personally LOVED it!

review_title: An embarrassment to the human race
review_detailed_main:
Oh Adam Sandler I remember when you use to be funny. I remember watching you 1990 underrated classics suck as Happy Gilmore and the Waterboy but since the 2000s have come you have started to pull your self down from one of the all time most underrated comic actors to not just one of the worst actors In cinema history to one on the worst human beings in the last 25 years.

First of all this film is just plain unwatchable. Their is literally a whole scene where the two main characters both played by Adam Sandler are both talking in what they call twin language, which is just them speaking complete gibberish. The acting is awful, the jokes are never funny and every time Jill speaks I cringed and thought "why!? Just why would a human being make a film which no one who has even a bit of common scene would say is a good film" I mean for f***s sake Al Pachino is in this film. AL PACHINO!!! One of my all time favourite actors is in this piece of s***. If Adam Sandler ever see's this review (which I very much doubt) I have one thing to say to him. "DON'T PULL GREAT ACTORS DOWN WITH YOU"

Overall I can say this is the worst movie I have seen in my life and hope to never see it again. If I could i would give this film a 0 out of 10 but IMDb's scoring doesn't allow me so I gave it a 1 out of 10.

review_title: A staple in cinematic history of poor comedy
Jack and Jill went up the hill; why did they have to come down?
review_detailed_main:
Well well well, what do we have here? Another Adam Sandler film that fails to be funny? One that only further pushes he career down the toilet like a stubborn turd? Adam Sandler USED to create some funny films guys, Waterboy has to be one of the funniest films i watched when i was small.

So here we are, faced with a NEW film, where Adam dresses up as a woman and pretends to be his own twin.

EVERYTHING. and i mean, EVERYTHING about the characters in this film is freakin' annoying, i truly did hate all of them before the film ended. We have, Jill, a lonely woman that looks like a UFC Heavyweight, thats just so annoying, i began searching OTHER FILMS whilst watching. Jack (Adam Sandler) plays a well established person that has made it in life. (and is just me, or is he getting a bit familiar with this, see Grown Ups)

I don't really wanna ruin this for y.. just kidding, of course i will. DON'T watch this film, the studio has already earned their money back from this film, so anyone else that rents/buys is just going to add more money to that repetitive, dull, annoying film producing machine known as Adam Sandler. Sorry to say this, but i will NOT be renewing my Adam Sandler's Fanclub Magazine. Also, Al Pachino, really? Were you that desperate for money? You were SCARFACE. SCARFACE.

Jack and Jill is the very bottom of the comedy barrel, Jack and Jill is so bad, its below the barrel. Actually, Jack and Jill is that awful, it shouldn't even be said in the same sentence as barrel.
I Hate that stupid Movie and it is not really Fun for me!!

review_title: Truly the Worst Half a Film I have Ever Seen - Desperate Rubbish
review_detailed_main: i cannot believe that with the amount of talent around in the arts in general that something this bad could ever have been made. i went with a friend in a wheelchair who has learning difficulties. He rarely gets out and would pretty much sit through anything vaguely funny or entertaining. The cinema was pretty much empty and half way through he said in a loud voice THIS IS TERRIBLE - LETS GET OUT OF HERE! i only wish i could have been that honest that loudly. We left with relief - i have no idea what happened in the rest of the film and have no wish to know. It must have cost a lot of money to make any film like this - what were they thinking? did anyone preview it? . i cant even believe it will up as cult badness its just terrible

Jack and Jill is a hideous movie that aims for the lowest common denominator. This isn't comedy, it's desperation and laziness. Like many a comedian before him, Sandler has decided to take on duel roles as brother and sister. When will these people realise they are not Peter Sellers or Alec Guinness. It takes great skill to seamlessly integrate yourself as more than one character. Here all I saw was Sandler in drag. Jack and Jill is about Jack, a director of commercials trying to land Al Pacino in a Dunken Donuts commercial. His sister arrives for Thanksgiving and she is the most horrible human being you can imagine. This was my biggest problem with the movie. There is nothing to connect us with this foul waste of space. Like Mater in Cars 2, this character is infuriating, She has no people skills. SHe is offensive, ignorant, loud, and just revolting. Sandler must feel destroyed by his family in some way, because with this and Click, he shows himself as a decent hard working man, constantly shat on my his family. Holmes is the worst wife in the world, not to mention a bland character. She repeatedly enables Jill to continue acting the way she does. The film tries to squeeze out some emotion, but fails, because we hate this bitch. If she was bullied when she was young, then perhaps the film makers should have shown this. Pacino has a lot of fun as himself, but the only way I wasn't embarrassed was by imagining his pay cheque. On top of all this the jokes aren't funny and the editing is abysmal. One scene sets up a joke, as Jill must find her way home without a car, and then it skips the punchline and gives us one to a scene they never showed us. It's confusing. As is the moment when the movie tried to get laughs from showing the face of Felipe's grandmother. I didn't know why they kept showing her, but once I looked on IMDb, I saw the same actor played both Felipe and the grandmother. This joke doesn't work if you don't know that. The film avoids the lowest rating barely, by having some fun jokes. Such as Johnny Depp in a Justin Bieber T-Shirt, or Spade mocking Rob Schneider. Predictable, crude, heartless, and annoying. This is a film that must be hated.

review_title: Usually I like the corny humor and the special characters
review_detailed_main:
Usually I like the corny humor and the special characters, but in this most of what I like is not present and the big lead is taken over by the very loud and annoying Jill, where maybe Jack would have been more in the picture and made it a better movie if his Sister could just shut up and go with the flow once in a while :)

There are some good moments, some good lines, but mostly it just gets a bit too exaggerated and too much actually. I like Adam Sandler and his new and more serious roles, this is not one of them and maybe the lowest point of his films yet.

It could have been more and with many good actors it should have been, but it centerers too much on the wrong things and becomes a parody of itself at a very early state.

I really like most of adam sandler's movies. but this one was really really bad. Twin that don't get along with each other. the Jill's voice (female sandler) is really annoying. I'ts a comedy movie that tried hard to be funny but unfortunately did not succeed.

I can't help but wonder what's going on thru Sandler's mind when he made this. It's like watching Dexter and Dee Dee but as humans with the same exaggerations and comic antics. i guess it's only funny when it's cartoons.

it's just plain bad. I gave it a chance, but halfway thru the movie i must admit the painful truth that i wasted my money on such a movie. it can even top my list of worst movies ever.

review_title: One of the oddball reviewers who actually enjoyed it!
review_detailed_main: Obviously this wasn't going to win an Oscar, but it made me laugh! Maybe one of the reasons was because the relationship and personalities of Jack and Jill were so ridiculously similar to two of my siblings. Okay Jill was a bit more over the top! But I think Adam pulled it off well. And I started watching this movie, not expecting very much because of the reviews. I've seen some real stinkers from Sandler, like that "Zohan" one (weird and gross) and "Anger Management". This was way better than those. Not quite as much crude humor, so that was a welcome relief. Sure, there were several parts that were not very believable, but I don't think this movie set out to be realistic. Al Pacino is hilarious - the scenes where he's onstage especially are gold. If you just want to watch a movie that makes you laugh and need a break from all the serious dramas, then I recommend it.

review_title: "Jack and Jill" belongs in a nursery of movie misfires

review_detailed_main: Full of good jokes and comedy. It's honestly really funny. Doesn't have a good story line, well not VERY good, but is very comical.

review_title: The worst film I have ever seen..
This is by far his worst.
Jack & Jill is a Mediocre Sandler Movie
review_detailed_main:
I'm a big Adam Sandler fan, but Jack & Jill was a mediocre effort. The film had some laughs (mostly captured in the trailers), but the movie was stalled by too many somber stretches with Jill (sister played by Adam Sandler) and the forced scenes with Al Pacino.

Sandler's regular cast of sidekicks (his cross-eyed friend, the dumb guy, Rob Schneider, David Spade) filled the movie. They provided a few funny moments, but most of their scenes bombed or were pointless.

The oddest role was Al Pacino playing a desperate Al Pacino. His scenes seemed to drag on with no purpose. The scenes were difficult to endure, as he tried to romance Jill (female Sandler).

The movie had many, many celebrity cameos, which are fun to see and even better if they are funny or add to the movie. Johnny Depp & Shaq were two of the better cameos.

Overall, the movie probably isn't worth a movie ticket. Jack & Jill is more of a Netflix rental down the road. Or, better yet, check out a funnier old school Sandler film like Happy Gilmore, or one of his better relationship films like 50 First Dates or Just Go With It.

I'm pretty sure it has been said and written many times before, and like other reviewers, I am a fan of Adam Sandler's. I enjoyed most of his other films, but this movie was a mistake. I can only imagine that he's gotten to that point in his career where he has surrounded himself with "Yes" men and women, or someone would have told him it's not working. Unlike other films where actor/comedians are able to pull of multiple characters in a scene, (ie. Eddie Murphy), this film is just Adam Sandler and an annoying Adam Sandler in drag. Part of the limited plot surrounds trying to convince Al Pacino to lower his standards to do a Dunkin Donut commercial. After appearing in this film, I think it would be a leg up for Pacino's career. The whole main plot-line barely made sense. I mean, why would an establish legend in Al Pacino (playing himself) be attracted to Jill (Sandler in drag). I also didn't like how earlier Jill was introduced. There was no build up to her character, and no suspense.

If you plan to watch this film, I'd advise you to wait a couple weeks for Netflix to feature it for free or online, or basically anywhere in which you won't be paying!. Then, at least, you won't feel obliged to watch more than the first 15 minutes. It really was a waste a time and one of the worst films of 2011 (if not the worst).

I had heard how bad this was, I even heard how it "swept" the razzies, I can't stand Adam Sandler (I'm Australian & he ripped off one of our movies...yes he DID!!)

I was however on a plane, the movie was playing for free & I was bored. And boy oh boy the reviews were right! The critics were right! This movie is AWFUL! Adam Sandler producing crap like this is par for the course, but Al Pacino? Was he blackmailed? Did he lose a bet or something?? Did Adam Sandler save him from drowning while they happened to be holidaying at the same resort or something? I had to watch "The Godfather Part II" for some peace of mind a few days later, & I'm still in shock...

This is the worst Adam Sandler movie I have ever seen , Ridiculous story and very disgusting jokes ! this may be a funny film for a 10 years old kid ! I was so surprised to see Al Pacino and Johnny Depp in the movie !!! I wish Al Pacino had not done this! Although they both play their own real characters but I really do not understand why on earth a great actor like Al Pacino would play in such a lame movie ... The Only good part of this movie is it's beginning and endings where real twins talk about themselves and their stories which is not part of the story at all !! Adam Sandler is a very talented comedian but I believe he still stands second to Jim Carrey !! ... but He could have done much much better !

review_title: Adam Sandler Needs An Oscar Nom
review_detailed_main:
This movie is a masterpiece.

Sandler's performance as both the male and female character is something completely original and never been done before. It's quite beautiful how he managed to come up with an idea so unique and breathtaking that it just rocks my entire world.

Jill's character is so deeply well written and emotionally intuned with the rest of the cast, that the watcher of this movie connects with her character on a spiritual level. Her dialogue is so deftly woven into the screenplay, we can't help but want MORE JILL!!!

The child actors in this movie are TYGHT! 👌 They are beautiful, and lovable, and even the GREEK GODS envy them. I mean, who doesn't?

Haters of this movie are blind to the society we live in. The political background of this movie is what truly makes it genius, and anyone who cant understand the references to our government are lower than a rattlesnakes belly.

Adam Sandler has proven once again that he is a force to be reckoned with in this biz, and he absolutely will be nominated for an Oscar for this masterpiece. His genius is one of the greatest human accomplishments in mankinds history, and I'm proud to say I stan that human GOD!

Love, Autry

P.S. This masterpiece is LIVING for a sequel. Maybe even two. And a prequel.

review_title: This Saved My Marriage And Sex Life

review_detailed_main:
I think all the one stars are a bit unfair.

This is an Adam Sandler film, full of silly slap stick comedy. It's not great drama, or high brow intellectual comedy. It's just silly fun. Great for watching at home with the family.

I'd imagine people feel the peer pressure more in the cinema, and feel less inclined to laugh at some of the gags.

If you liked Happy Gilmore, Big Daddy,Water Boy, Click, Wedding Singer etc... You'll like this. If you don't like those films, don't waste your time and money watching this, you won't like it.

We liked it!

0/5

Oh Adam Sandler, how you have degraded. From his glory days of Happy Gilmore, Billy Madison and Big Daddy, this is truly the unfortunate trough in his career. Remember when your parents stopped or discouraged you from watching a screen because it apparently eroded your braincells? Well, here's something that validates that particular nag. Being comfortably amongst the worst if not the worst film I have seen, I'm going to do something I've never done and unhesitatingly award this film zero.

After becoming the talk of the town following its sweeping of the Razzies, the first time a film has ever done so, it attracted my interest. Ultimately, to genuinely appreciate works of art in cinema, we need to be able to identify and understand the flip side. This represents a pin-up example, one of those ill-fated catastrophes where there is nothing to praise in any way and everything to vilify. There have unquestionably been worse premises for comedies but it was execution that let this down miserably. Execution in every possible facet of cinema. The story was lame, predictable and exceeded the limits of senselessness and brainlessness that an individual can tolerate. The dialogue is unintelligibly stupid and unfunny. I couldn't help but disconnect from it. And in all honesty, even if I was paying rapt attention, I doubt I would have found anything that could be remotely termed as comedy.

Adam Sandler is by no stretch of the imagination a poor comedian but this is the nadir of his work. Jack is the bread and butter Sandler character that we just seem to see in every film of his nowadays. Jill, on the other hand, is easily his most calamitous creation yet. She resembles a transvestite and I think that statement conveys my thoughts of the character best. There is just no clear distinction between the two characters Sandler played simultaneously. Playing multiple roles begs the ability to seamlessly absorb yourself into each separate character and forge an identity for each. In a comic context, Mike Myers did this brilliantly in 'Austin Powers'. In this case, without offence intended, all I could see was a cross-dressing Adam Sandler employing a cringeworthy, transsexual sounding voice. Jill eventually does little to dispel these negative perceptions, she's just an annoying, unintelligent pest.

I'm unsure as to how I sat through this cinematic disaster but I did so staring blankly at the screen. I can waffle on about the deficits of this forever but take it from me, nothing redeemed it, nothing helped it and every minute made it even worse. The only reason you'll ever need to see this is to understand the lowest quality of cinematic art.

review_title: Probably the worst movie ever made
review_detailed_main:
Went to see this with a few friends in the cinema, and was actually embarrassed that we were watching this. Thankfully I didn't chose the movie but hey you can't always go see a great movie!

Don't waste your money. Honestly, what a waste of time.

I like Adam Sandler but what was he thinking? I did laugh but I was laughing at the stupidity of some of the gags.

Al Pacino was in it and he is an actor I hold immense respect for. He was either on drugs when he said yes to this or is broke.

I know I'm really ripping into the film but it was just the worst movie I have ever watched.

review_title: These people should not be making films. They have only the most threadbare knowledge of filmmaking and even less regard for storytelling itself

review_detailed_main: Firstly, Jill's voice was just a pain to listen to. I did not hear a single laugh when I saw this movie. How can this be classified as comedy ? I still don't understand why Al Pacino was in this movie, the man who was in Scarface acted in this crappy movie. It wasn't interesting or funny in anyway. This is probably a career ender for Adam Sandler. When Jack or Jill was supposedly saying a joke it would be a really bad one and that is the only reason people laughed. Why would you play both characters? It is still a mystery to me why someone like Katie Holmes would be in a rubbish movie like this. I do not recommend anyone to see this movie, save your money and go see some real comedy.

Now I'm not a big fan of Adam Sandler movies, off the top of my head I can only name one or two that I can actually tolerate without earplugs and a blindfold!! Although out of all these movies, Jack And Jill is by far the worst. For starters why did Sandler have to make Jill have the most annoying voice ever? It sounds like someone is dragging their nails down a chalk board, I know he was trying to go way over the top with Jill but come on, really? Also, how could you take a massive cameo from an amazing actor such as Al Pacino, use that cameo for most of the film and make a complete mess of it? Don't even get me started on the attempts at comedy, the only time I laughed was with joy when he was with joy when the film was over! Moral of the story: don't watch this movie... unless you enjoy having a week-long headache afterwards.

Jack Sadelstein (Adam Sandler) is a successful L.A. advertising executive with wife Erin (Katie Holmes) and kids. He hates Thanksgiving when his twin sister Jill (Adam Sandler) visits.

Rarely do I hate a movie. I always appreciate how hard it is to get something done. So there has to be something dramatically wrong, morally repugnant, or societally damaging. As much as it was annoying the heck out of me, it didn't fall to the lowest rating. I give it one notch up from the bottom. Jack is actually functional, and I'm willing to see how Katie Holmes would screw this up. But Jill is horrible. She is ugly (on the inside). I wouldn't sit and listen to her in real life. So why should I sit and watch her on screen. Save yourself and skip this! Even if you're a die-hard Adam Sandler fan.

Of course this movie does not deserve an 8 out of 10, but maybe a 6 point something. It is comedic and silly and you get to see Al Pacino in a non monster role. It absolutely deserves more than a 3.3.

review_title: I thought it was really good.

review_detailed_main:
I Highly disagree with what most people have said about this film because of the fact that it actually is very funny, the only downside is yes it lacks a good story line but is still a good film.

People probably went in expecting a lot from Adam Sandler because most of his films are hilarious and great for the whole family, although this is not his best one this is certainly not his worst.

Definitely under rated and I highly disagree with this low rating, There was also a lot of product placement but that was what created the film, there also was adult humour but thats what makes it great for the whole family, I love this film, i laughed a lot. (very loudly)

review_title: One star only because zero isn't an option

review_detailed_main: This is the worst film I've seen for a long time. "Jill"'s voice is constantly annoying. The storyline is unoriginal, limited, predictable & oh so incredibly boring. Most of the film made me cringe (especially for Al Pacino-who can obviously laugh at himself, but must regret doing this). Too many clichés & too much effort for laughs resulting in an un-funny film. The best actor was the cockatoo. In fact, if the bird had written the screenplay it could only have improved it. 1 out of 10 is too high a score, but apparently you can't give less, so I'm giving the one (for the cockatoo ;-)) I hope Adam Sandler quickly does something really good very soon, as I fear that "Jack and Jill" may possibly be professional suicide.

Lately Adam Sandler is loosing all the credit he had from previous movies. Jokes here are lame, very slow, not funny and parts a very predictable. Pacino appearance i think is one star of the 3 i gave to this movie. I don't understand why he is in this movie...same as i don't understand DeNiro on Machete (another Disappointment) but anyway...whatever

Is too much 90 minutes of this movie, i was ready to leave after the first 20 min, but the only way to rate something is seeing all of it... I recommend don't waste time seeing it and better wait until another good job of Adam Sandler.....

¨His twin sister is coming for the holidaysand it ain't pretty.¨

Adam Sandler stars in yet another disastrous comedy this year, this time playing two characters: a male and female version of himself. This is just one of those movies Sandler could make with his eyes closed. It requires no dedication from him whatsoever and I don't blame him. Why try to change what you do when it is having results? It doesn't matter that the critics don't enjoy his films because the audience seems to keep on coming back for more. I find most of his films pretty much alike and haven't enjoyed one of them in a long time, but it doesn't matter because Sandler fans will continue to support his movies and fill theater seats. One thing is for sure, Sandler has a lot of fun at work. He probably has a blast making these easy movies which don't have anything memorable about them, but sometimes are enough for a few laughs. I think I enjoyed Just go With It a little more than this movie, but I really had a hard time deciding which film was worse. Director Dennis Dugan has worked many times with Sandler in the past beginning with Happy Gilmore, Big Daddy, and ending with Grown Ups and Just Go With It. They seem to be making the same films over and over again and repeating the same jokes, but Sandler has his fan base and he stays true to them. I enjoyed his earlier films, but have stopped doing so in recent years. The jokes have gotten old and there are many other better comedies coming out these days. I wouldn't be surprised if this film actually wins every Razzie Award it's been nominated for, including Worst Picture.

Jack Sadelstein (Adam Sandler) is a successful commercial producer who has a happy life alongside his wife, Erin (Katie Holmes), and two children, Sofia (Elodie Tougne) and Gary (Rohan Chand). They are expecting Jack's twin sister, Jill (Adam Sandler), annual visit for Thanksgiving. Jack doesn't get along with Jill very much although she thinks the best of him and misses the old days when they spent all day together. The truth is Jill is very loud and obnoxious and Jack enjoys his normal and quiet family life. What should have been only a weekend visit ends up being a long one since Jill feels lonely after her mother has passed away. She ends up staying and things get out of hand at times. In the meantime, Jack needs to sign Al Pacino (played by himself) for a commercial and so decides to try to convince him to accept the offer. Pacino ends up falling in love with Jill, but she wants nothing to do with him. Jack tries to use her in order to convince him to do the commercial but things begin to get out of hand. The film doesn't really have much of a plot as we have to sit down and see a Sandler double feature but that is pretty much all I can say about the plot synopsis.

I don't see how anyone could actually enjoy this film, but I'm guessing most Sandler fans will like this considering they get to see two Sandler characters. The highlight of the films might be the special cameo appearances as we get to see Shaq, David Spade, Norm MacDonald, Dana Carvey, Regis Philbin, Dan Patrick, Drew Carey, John McEnroe, and Johnny Depp among many others. I don't know how Sandler gets all these people to show up in his movies but somehow he manages too. This may be Al Pacino's worst role to date, I guess he just wanted to try something new, but he looked absolutely ridiculous in this film. Katie Holmes was alright, she didn't have to do much, and her character wasn't funny so she just played a safe role. Eugenio Derbez was the best thing about the movie. His character, Felipe the gardener, was by far the funniest thing about Jack and Jill. There is not much more I can say about this, It is really a lazy comedy, but I can see how all these actors might have had such a fun time playing together and making easy money. I was tempted to stop watching this movie right after it started, but I decided to suck it up and stay to the end. My favorite scene was when Jill was working out in the cruise with the two beefed up men and making them look bad. I really laughed hard at that scene, probably because I was just too bored with the rest of this terrible movie.

review_title: Jack and Jill has officially ended me.
review_detailed_main: I've hit rock bottom. I cannot go any lower. Burning in hell would be more entertaining than watching this "comedy" again. Satan...take me! One Sandler still making outdated comedies is more than enough. To have two Sandlers in the same film is the stuff of nightmares. The catalyst in creating a colossal black hole that will end the universe as we know it. Sandler dressing as a woman to portray a twin sister should be disallowed. Illegal. A crime against humanity. It's not even a case of the comedy being outdated, because I am one million percent sure it still would not be funny. Twenty, thirty, heck make it fifty years. Toilet humour isn't funny (including but not limited to farting in the cinema, violently excreting after consuming Mexican food and explicitly scratching one's testicles). Annoying characters aren't funny. Sandler isn't funny. Two Sandlers aren't funny. Sandler dressed as a female purposefully showing off his masculine shaved legs isn't funny. You see my point. I'm not even going to describe the plot, it would be a waste of a sentence that could be better used to decimate this atrocity. Holmes was underus...wait...wasn't used at all. The screenplay contained absolutely zero laughs. I didn't even smile, not even a smirk. Just large glaring eyes as I stared at the screen bewildered by what I just experienced. Pacino...why? The only one with a worthwhile committed performance, because he was playing himself. No acting required. Although subjugating yourself to an advertisement for donuts where you sing "Dunkaccino" does make you wonder why such an acclaimed actor would do this. The last line of the film is "Burn this! Don't let anybody see this!". Ironically, I feel the same about this film. Thinking about watching this? Go outside, run to the local store, buy (or perhaps steal...) a copy of the film and give it to your best friend. Then watch them suffer as you laugh maniacally. That'll make for a more amusing time then watching this. Sandler can no longer come back from this. His professional career is officially deceased in my eyes. Goodbye.

This could have been a really great and cute movie if it didn't try so hard to be really great and cute! Does that make any sense?

To me, the plot got lost in all the product placement and dazzle of Adam Sandler's friends list. (How many a-list celebs were in this movie, did they all lose a bet or something?)

There were so many deliberate shots of famous people and of Sony logos and electronic devices, along with Cadillac automobiles, 5-star restaurants, lavish cruise lines and background scenery we missed the point of the story.

Too bad, because twins are a special thing even if they are CGI, this movie absolutely missed that mark entirely.

review_title: Jack and Jill went up the hill and made an awful movie
review_detailed_main:
Adam "facking" Sandler makes me want to go out and start an only sexual relationship with a homeless person because you know what that's better then watching anything with the Sandman in it. I would prefer to have Danny Dyer in the film because every couple of minutes you would hear, "Hi i'm Danny Dyer" (in a cockney accent), this would probably bring more laughs then the Sandman and the whole of Jack and Jill. Going off the Sandman for a minute I thought I would comment on the other acting atrocities in this film, Al Pacino a 7 time academy award nominee and a one time winner decided to be in this film I can only assume he did this because he wasn't quite good enough to get in Danny Dyer's latest film. Katie Holmes is reasonably fit, I mean she's no 9 or 10 but she's at least a 7 and a half so she can't have been sleeping with Sandler, maybe she was emotionally distraught after not getting in the latest Danny Dyer film as well. It is stupidly named as he always makes it, perhaps they should rename it mission improbable or mission unlikely but we've got a chance.

Adam "facking" Sandler aka the Sandman is the white Eddie Murphy,(This makes sense if your familiar with my reviews)he really makes me as angry as a fat man walking past a closed Greggs. As the old Nursery rhyme goes Jack and Jill went up the hill and made an awful movie.

review_title: This film needs a warning label on it
review_detailed_main:
Okay, so I'm not Adam Sadler's biggest fan. His films are hit and miss in my opinion, but I'm always willing to give them a go (I did recently enjoy Funny People). However, this is one time when I should have researched a film before I watched it. If you look at the online reviews you'll see what I mean.

The other thing I should point out is that my 'review' is only based on the first half an hour. That was all I could stand. I'm sorry. I hope I'm not doing this film a massive disservice by not watching it in its entirety. Perhaps it really picked up and I missed some real comic gold. However, from the opening act, I really don't think so.

Adam Sadler plays two roles - twins Jack and his 'identical' sister Jill. Jill comes to stay with his family and 'hilarity' results. Unfortunately, Jill is the most annoying character ever to grace cinema screens. I know what you're thinking - you're thinking that you've seen the Phantom Menace and that no one can top Jar Jar Binks. Wrong! Seriously, it's like Jar Jar has had a baby with Ruby Rhod from the Fifth Element and produced Jill. All she does is shriek on and on, in between generally being rude and stupid and insensitive towards anyone who is unlucky enough to get near her.

Now, I have nothing against annoying characters in films. If a character is annoying then that's part of who they are. My problem with Jack and Jill is how other characters deal with them. If we meet someone annoying, we stay well clear. However, in this film everyone extends her too much courtesy to make it believable. Yes, I know she's family, but even so, you wouldn't let her anywhere near you if you know what she's like. Yet, everyone makes massive allowances for her, even berating her long-suffering twin brother Jack (who is pretty unlikeable in himself) for not being nicer to her.

In short, there is not a rating low enough to describe this rubbish. Do not watch it, it's truly that bad. The only thing vaguely interesting about it is how they persuaded Al Pacino to appear in it. Does he really need the money that badly?

Someone explain to me why Pedro Almodovar is supposed to be cutting edge outrageous and Adam Sandler is called stoopid.

I look forward to everything Sandler does and he delivers every time. This current film is pushing the envelope in it's depiction of the twin relationship and the way it turns. It gives Sandler a chance to do three (not two) characters, which he aces, and the effects work is so in-obvious that no one notices - Brother Adam dragging sister Adam, dancing together etc. Another thing people miss is the back story, where Sister Adam nursed their mother while brother Adam went on to put together the nice house, business and family.

It's really hard to keep up with all the walk ons - Bruce Jenner, David Spade in drag, Santo Sequra. Also love the cockatoo in the chocolate fountain.

review_title: No surprise - it's as bad as you've heard
Should a comedy be funny?, if so this film is a comedy
"Burn this. This must never be seen, by anyone."
review_detailed_main: Jack and Jill is a 2011 comedy directed by Dennis Dugan and starring Adam Sandler, Al Pacino and Katie Holmes. While I didn't dislike it as much as I thought I would, this is still an utterly awfull film and probably the worst comedy I have ever seen. The acting is all either bad or bland, except maybe Pacino who is in my opinion the best part of the film, and Adam Sandler as Jill is one of the most annoying performances I have ever seen. The story is generic, uninteresting and extremely boring, there are a few scenes that did make me chuckle like when the old hispanic lady gets hit in the face but most of the comedy just isn't funny. This turned out to not be as awfull of an experience as I expected and it's not nearly as bad as other films I've seen like Wrong Turn 6 or The Avengers (the 1998 film not the one from the MCU) however it's still really, REALLY bad. 2.5/10

Another motion picture that my bro wanted to show me, and I can't believe it, but Adam Sandler has done it again. I remember even less about Jack and Jill than I do Little Nicky, and I just finished watching it. Adam Sandler is as annoying as ever and has clearly earned his awards of "Worst Male Actor" and "Worst Female Actor," not to mention this film receiving "Worst Screenplay" and "Worst Picture" in 2012. Why does Sandler need to play both Jack and Jill? They got the worst actor to star in the same film twice, at the same time. More annoying impressions, a strange plot, blatantly obvious product placement, and confusing motives.

What was good about this movie? Thinking back on it, not much, but it wasn't nearly as offensively bad as Little Nicky is, which ranks it slightly higher on my list.

Judgement Kazzy, signing off.

Pacino shouldn't have accepted the role, he is more for thriller, horror, and sci fi movies. Come on Pacino, think! You're losing your mind as you grow older.

After all, Jack and Jill was being used with amazing utensils, but turned out to be a horrible drawing with a horrible artist.

review_title: 10/10 for being so very, very bad.
review_detailed_main: OK, we all realise that Sandler plays Sandler. He plays a real "goofy" sister (why is that funny?) BUT Pacino proves he is the greatest screen actor by bringing credibility to this "film". It is awful BUT there are some great one liners and jokes. "In" jokes that are not now funny -and were probably not funny then? Sandler encourages "Jewish" "jokery" throughout - in the way that only certain people can? He plays his twin as slightly goofy AKA as "retarded" in the way that Sandler always does - and he is no Jerry Lewis is he? BUT, again that word, It DOES deliver laughs. If only he had found an actress to play the role of the twin sister then maybe this film could have delivered but you only see, even with the trickery: Sandler in drag, very odd. In fact with black face white face issues maybe someone playing a straight female as a man might be questionable - are there no cross dressing actors in Hollywood? This film made money and if you do watch it at Xmas, then watch it with the young kids and their old grannies, as they WILL giggle. A film not for those found in-between childhood or near death But Al Pacino walks it.

Let me start by saying that Allen Covert as a "Homless Guy" is probably the best part of this film. Now this movie right from the get go, seemed to have potential and this later shines through in some great laughs along the way, though two big problems rear their ugly heads early on.

The first being that Adam Sandler is not really the most attractive man in the world and it seems like the makeup department failed to realizes this, because they put forward no effort to make him actually look like a woman. There is a point in the movie where you actually get to see how much work he goes through in his gender change, lets just say I'm not impressed. The other actors that play opposite genders in there movie tend to do it about a 100X more convincingly, when I see Madea I don't think "Hey that's just Tyler Perry in drag" I look at Madea and see a hilarious black woman, that if nobody had told me was a man I would have never figured out on my own. This is not the case with Jill, who you think of as a woman, but every time you see her breaks this illusion by simply being Adam Sandler in a wig.

The second big problem with this movie is Katie Holmes, whether you love her or you hate her it just seems glaringly obvious that she didn't belong in this movie. I've never looked at Katie Holmes as a comedy actress and that is probably because she has never made me laugh and after watching this movie that record has continued. I don't think she's a bad actress by any means, but there were probably about a thousand better options for the role. She doesn't play off of Sandler very well and they really just seem like 2 people pretending to be married, this is probably the weakest paring that Sandler has ever been a part of on the big screen. By the time this movie ends if have anything at all to say about Katie Holmes character, I highly doubt it anything good.

All-in-all my opinion is that this movie probably shouldn't have been made in the first place, the weak pointless storyline, the shallow and mildly upsetting characters, and the fact that the estimated budget for this ridicules film was almost $80 million, all add up to disaster in my book, a disaster that you should probably avoid.

review_title: One of the worst movies ever made
review_detailed_main: This movie was painful. It was worse than a day at the dentist. I usually really like Adam Sandler, he has some very funny movies (i.e. The Waterboy, Happy Gilmore, Big Daddy, That's My Boy, The Wedding Singer) but this movie made me want to rip my eyes and ears out of my head. There is nothing funny about Adam Sandler playing a woman- it is the definition of obnoxious. Do not waste your time with this abomination. You would be better off smashing your face into a brick wall over and over.

I saw this movie with my parents (51) and my sister (16) and her boyfriend (17) today. I am a die hard Sandler fan, honestly you should know what to expect when you go to see his movies, fart jokes pretty much, and these are abundant.

Because I enjoy Sandler I found this movie laugh out loud funny, as did my family. Plenty of cringe worthy acting moments, mistimed lines, inappropriate outbursts from Jack. But it's bearable, there is nothing intelligent about the comedy, just an easy going, funny, immature movie. Not award winning but a decent escape.

If you get Sandler, see it. If you don't, give it a miss.

review_title: Jack and Jill (2011) - Adam Sandler Went Up the Hill Too Far!
review_detailed_main: Here's a nursery rhyme: "Jack and Jill went up the hill to make a crappy movie, Adam Sandler joined in, but broke his crown, and Al Pacino made a fool of himself." Not really good, right? So, "Jack and Jill" stars Adam Sandler as Jack, a rich advertising executive, and Jill, his annoying and obnoxious twin sister (the female version of himself). She decides to stay with Jack for the holidays, but no matter what, she refuses to leave. Now, the torture has commenced. This is not only the worst movie of the previous year, but this is also the worst movie in Adam Sandler's life-time career. This is a surprisingly boring, painfully annoying, and incredibly tasteless, unfunny piece of junk that really tries it's best, really hard. For example, there's a Thanksgiving scene when there is so much dialogue coming out of people's mouths, that it's just not funny. They're repeating dialogue after dialogue, it's completely not funny, and you want them to just shut up. I'm just glad that the homeless person sitting at the Thanksgiving dinner in that scene was embarrassed to be a part of the stupidness, and left at the second. There is so many stupid scenes that involves characters getting hit either in the face or in their private areas, racism involving an obnoxious Indian child, fart jokes, 'crap their pants' jokes, and over-the-top complaining from an annoying twin sister. Who thought this stuff would be funny? Also, Katie Holmes is in the movie as Jack's wife. She's really cute, but she doesn't do anything. Another fine actor that looks embarrassed to be a part of this piece of garbage is Al Pacino playing...well...Al Pacino, who falls in love with Jill, because he thinks she's special. I don't know why! Jack wants Jill to date Al Pacino, so Al can be in Jack's "Dunkin Donuts" commercial. Oh, that's hilarious....not! Even if I chuckled at Pacino making references of his only Oscar being destroyed, and reciting old movie lines from his previous films, that didn't help save the movie, though! From the embarrassing cameos of such great actors, a script that's totally useless, to a cast that has no idea why this movie is being made, "Jack and Jill" is complete schlock from start to finish. You take a look at Adam Sandler's career, and see the other funnier movies that he has made in the past, such as "Billy Madison", "Happy Gilmore", "The Waterboy", and "The Wedding Singer", you start to wonder why the hell is Adam Sandler making such crappy movies these days. From the opening scenes to the end credits, this is one of the worst movies of this or any other decade, generation, or light-year from now. "Jack and Jill", in my review, "Boring, tasteless, embarrassing, unfunny, and a giant piece of crap".

It's really quite difficult to put into words how bad this film is, really, I'm not exaggerating, it has no redeeming qualities whatsoever. Not even the presence of Al Pacino (why, Al, why?) can do anything with the steaming pile of putrescent dog vomit that it resembles.

How it cost an estimate $79,000,000 to make is astounding but even more astounding is how it managed to earn nearly $75,000,000 of that back at the US box office, and that's really, really sad, because it will make money, and the investors will get paid but if it had completely tanked at the box office, as it, by all that is sane, should have, then the investors would have been burned, Sandler would end up taking celebrity cameos in other people's terrible films and we'd never have to suffer his talentless rubbish ever again.

If you have children, spare them from this muck, seriously, it should come with a health warning...

"Avoid - May Make Your Children Stupid"

I did not laugh a single time! Stay away from this movie. "Just Go With It" is ten times better.

I really don't know what Al Pacino is doing here... Or his glory days are over or he must be in really serious financial problems.

It's silly and IT'S JUST NOT FUNNY! I get the feeling that even Adam Sandler knew it would become such an awful movie.

I couldn't wait for the movie to end to get the hell out of the theater, but I had to stay until the end because of my friends. Well, don't watch it with your friends, because you won't be amused... at all.

Don't watch it!

Jack and Jill is a painful comedy that's extremely unfunny and extremely hard to watch. The plot is terrible and Adam Sandler's committed performances only make it worst and the rest of the cast are okay. Al Pacino is the only good thing in it and the musical number/advert at the end is the only funny part.

review_title: quite possibly the worst twin movie ever
review_detailed_main:
This is by far one of Adam Sandler's worst movies. I usually like him, but not in this. Sandler plays both Jack and Jill. Jill comes to visit for Thanksgiving and hangs out through the New Year. She is annoying, has a pet bird, and sweats a lot. Jack needs Al Pacino to star in a donut add and for some add reason, Al gets the hots for Jill. But, this is good for Jack, so he can get close to Al.

The whole thing was just silly, I mean Al Pacino wanting to date Jill. And Jill is just so manly and has such a whiny voice. It was just silly and not funny. Katie Holmes has a lackluster role in this, why was she even there?

FINAL VERDICT: Don't waste your time with this.

....there is a scene where Al Pacino receives a call on his cell phone while playing Hamlet. There , one can see the brilliance of Al Pacino's comedy value as he parodies himself. I think Pacino should have been involved in comedy more, much like R.De Niro, but it seems writers didn't want to spoil his mafia profile all these years. Also this movie could be seen as a Pacino play throughout. I think Sandler's strength in comedy lies elsewhere. He should have left this cross-dressing slapstick to some English actor, they are far more versatile and able on that kind of play.

Anyway, his is a MUST see scene.

review_title: I can understand those who couldn't sit through it 100%
review_detailed_main:
Look, it was really bad. There's absolutely no doubting or denying that. That being said, it wasn't so bad I couldn't sit through it, mainly due to the fact that the actors are inexplicable invested in the material. The acting never gets so dreadful or cringe worthy that you need to turn it off, if you can tolerate Sandler's nasally whining that is. I can definitely understand why so many couldn't though, and if the voice happens to be like nails on a chalk board for you there are absolutely no redeeming qualities to make it worth sitting through.

I happened to have the variable effect of watching it after nearly 4 years of awful reviews from critics and us regular folk alike, then hearing from a credible friend that it wasn't AS bad as advertised. So I went in with a weighted approach, expecting it to be horrendous but allowing for a little more leeway before deciding to turn it off. Lo and behold I survived.

IMDb has it at 3.5 at the moment and that's pretty apt. I guess if there's anything to take from reading this is it's tolerably bad for those who can get through a series of annoying character traits and those awful low brow Happy Madison gags that have sadly become a trademark of theirs, exposing an unfortunate side of Sandler's sense of humor that is painfully unfunny.

review_title: Sandler must be surrounding himself with "Yes" Men and Women
review_detailed_main:
Like other reviewers, I am a fan of Adam Sandler's. I enjoyed most of his other films, but this movie was a mistake. I can only imagine that he's gotten to that point in his career where he has surrounded himself with "Yes" men and women, or someone would have told him it's not working. This isn't Tootsie, nor Mrs Doubtfire, its just Sandler playing an annoying and mostly unfunny and unbalanced character. Unlike other films where actor/comedians are able to pull of multiple characters in a scene, (ie. Eddie Murphy), this film is just Adam Sandler and an annoying Adam Sandler in drag. Part of the limited plot surrounds trying to convince Al Pacino to lower his standards to do a Dunkin Donut commercial. After appearing in this film, I think it would be a leg up for Pacino's career.

I made the mistake of watching this on Vudu as a Pay-Per-View film...the best thing I can say is that I fell asleep halfway through it. If you plan to watch this film, I'd advise you to wait a couple weeks for Netflix to feature it for free. Then, at least, you won't feel obliged to watch more than the first 15 minutes.

I truly believe that this is the 2nd funniest adam sandler movie next to click (2006). Sandlers roll between Jack and Jill is amazing. The Jokes are funny as heck "twista with ya sista" is so funny . The Jared Fogle Cameo Does feel a bit outdated but who can blame it . Dunkaccino is one of the greatest songs ever. "Say hello to my chocolate blend" is such a good reference. Now look you may have your thoughts on this movie but in the end its adam sandler (Funniest man alive) and he always tries to brighten up anyones day .

review_title: A hilarious and enjoyable family film
review_detailed_main: I wasn't expecting this film to be any good after I read the poor reviews and number of stars critics slated it. You call this bad? It was very light-hearted and very funny. Adam Sandler gives the performance as the two main characters. He does a good portrayal as the antic and gleefully insane Jill and after a while you don't even notice it's him. It has an ensemble of famous people such as Al Pacino and and John McEnroe. Full of childish potty humour and adult laughter, did this film seriously deserve to win every category in the Razzies? No. Believe me. It ISN'T that bad. Okay let me say it again. It isn't that bad at all. It's only critics and the Razzie awards going over their heads over awfulness. It's just a typical Adam Sandler film. Ignore the reviews and watch it with your family because believe me, nothing is wrong with this movie (except for the continuity errors).
If you finish watching this movie...You will lose a big part of your soul. Teddy bear brought me here.

review_title: Jack and Jill Went Up the Hill to Fetch a Pail of Shame.
I didn't despise it as much as everyone else, but it's not good.
Poorly written, acted, and conceived! Should have never been filmed!!!!!
review_detailed_main:
Adam Sandler should be ashamed of himself for producing this movie. It is an embarrassment to the Happy Gilmore legacy! When I initially saw the trailers for this movie in theaters, I questioned why it was made because it just didn't seem to be believable. Now granted, Al Pacino was great as always and he delivered his lines with the professionalism that he dedicates to every project. However, not even Pacino could save this poorly written, ill-conceived, sad piece of drivel that permanently left a black stain on the Sandler franchise which will never be erased or forgotten.

Jack and Jill was lacking in imagination, creativity, humor, spontaneity, and any form of enjoyment that could even remotely entertain the viewer. Accordingly, I'm not sure why one of his friends that he repeatedly casts in his projects didn't quietly pull Adam aside and politely tell him that this movie was shite!

With the exception of Sandler himself, it was clear from the promotional interviews that all of those that acted in this movie were aware that it lacked to ability to be a breakout box office success. That just goes to show that his friends are willing to appear in anything Sandler writes, as long as it results in a financial bonanza for them. But if they would have been true friends, they would have told him just exactly how outrageous, flat, and disjointed this movie was w/ the exception of Al Pacino.

Jack and Jill clearly shouldn't have been greenlit by the studio since most of us could tell from the outset that it was an outrage! It ranks up there with other epic classics that failed at the box-office miserably including: Howard the Duck; Battlefield Earth: A Saga of the Year 3000; Waterworld; John Carter; and Death to Smoochy.

After seeing the movie trailer I decided to wait until this movie aired on cable to watch it, and that's exactly what I did because I was unwilling to invest any extra finances on it via Redbox or Netflix, and I certainly wasn't going to pay the price of a movie ticket to view it.

I hope that Sandler has taken time to reflect on this film failure in order to learn a valuable lesson about writing more enjoyable future films. Also, let's hope that the movie studios will stop green-lighting disappointing movie scripts like this one.

After all, people criticize Tyler Perry for his Madea character which they call annoying in some cases, but at least Mr. Perry makes profit with his movies because they are entertaining. Lately Adam Sandler's movies have become a disappointing means to a paycheck! And I hope that getting paid is not what's motivating him to write lately, or it just emphasizes just how sad the entertainment industry has become as an industry!!!!!!!

Okay, let me just clarify, this movie is NOT a perfect comedy. It's just a stupid, stupid movie. It's not 'The Artist', but what it is, is hilarious. I loved this film. It was great, it had its share of good moments and its bad moments, and I'm going to tell you them NOW!

PROS: First of all, in my opinion, it's an improvement from 'Just Go With It', it has funnier jokes (and there are plenty, but there are 1 or 2 that are a hit or a miss) Adam Sandler is funny AND likable as Jill, even if she is very annoying, but I think that was the whole point of her character, as Jack, he's just the same old wealthy Adam Sandler character we've seen dozens of times in his other films, but is still likable, even though when he's not supposed to be likable. Katie Holmes as Jack's wife Erin was sweet in the film and really likable, she's also smokin' hot and actually does a pretty good acting job for a film like this, she acts concerned, angry, upset and happy when she needs to and is also quite funny, too! The children were funny also, but they weren't featured too much in the film so I'll leave it at that. We get the small cameos from the Sandler regulars, David Spade, Peter Dante, Jonathan Loughran, the director Dennis Dugan, Allen Cover, and John McEnroe and Nick Swardson, and they were ALL funny, but the best part of the film HAS to be Al Pacino, I don't know why he doesn't do more comedies, he was hilarious in this film. The way he plays himself is so good, it's as if he lost his brain and just wondered onto the set so Adam Sandler said; 'Okay! He's in the movie!' He was easily the funniest part about the movie and I think he should actually do more comedies. I can't really say much about the story, it's just a family reunion caught on tape with the Al Pacino thing on the side, but it does all fit in.

CONS: Like my other reviews, there's only a few small problems with the movie, there's only a few jokes that I didn't like. And that's it.

To summarise, I don't see what's so bad about it, it's not as awful as everybody else is making it out to be, it's just a silly film to watch and laugh at, and that's what I did! It's not THAT bad, in fact, the film is quite sweet, it makes you feel good after watching it. When I mean sweet, I mean Adam Sandler has this brilliant ability to create these stupid movies that don't look very appealing, but once you open up your mind and actually watch it, you end up liking it and actually liking the characters and some of the sweet moments incorporated into the film. It's a sweet,feel good comedy film where you can have fun, and that's what film-goers need to start doing, just have FUN and stop nit- picking!

'JACK AND JILL'

Directed by: Dennis Dugan

Starring: Adam Sandler, Katie Holmes and Al Pacino

Oh my God this movie is so bad, so terrible, so painful to watch. This movie is childish and not in a good way, farting humor, sweating humor, screeching humor, oh my God this movie is awful. Adam Sandler what have you done? Why did you think any of it was even remotely funny? What were you on? Prescription painkillers? Because that is what you 'the viewer' is gonna need for the headache this movie will give you. It is beyond crap - it is worse than crap. It is so pointless and so unfunny it will give you nightmares! LOL Maybe not nightmares .... but maybe Adam SandlerMares... I do not know what was going through his mind when he decided to make this movie. Does he really think he is so funny - that unfunny things when said by him - in a squeaky voice - pretending to be a woman - is going to be funny anyway? What a disaster... How embarrassing would this be to walk down the red carpet and watch the premier of this movie with OTHER PEOPLE in the cinema. How could he hide his redcarpet face? Oh my God I do not believe this movie even got made. A spectacular waste of millions, better spent on buying up stale bread to feed ducks!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I can honestly say this is the worst movie I have ever seen. There are some films that can get by because it falls into a certain category such as a bad horror movie can be good because its bad. Adam Sandler has fallen into this category as of late the phrase "Its bad but its Sandler." is used more than often to describe his movies but I promise you this is just as bad as everyone has said. Sandler plays duel roles as Jack and Jill twin siblings which is a excuse for Sandler to dress in drag and do his high pitch Jewish voice, that's the joke and it goes on for about 90 dull minuets.

Jack is a rich guy working in advertising and his new goal is to land Al Pacino in a coffee commercial (who turns in the only funny moments in the film) His twin sister Jill comes to visit for the holidays and she is the most annoying person in the world. She is disgusting and knows nothing about the modern world, she proceeds to pick a fight with about every character in the film and then begins to cry after she does it, this goes on for the whole movie. I honestly don't understand this plot. Jack is played like a job obsessed jerk but he does everything to make his family happy. He takes Jill around so she can complete her to do list, setting her up on dates and letting her extend her stay longer and longer because you guessed it Al Pacino has fallen in love with Jill but she wants nothing to do with him but its the only way Jack can land him for his commercial.

There is no redeeming quality to this film and the only amusing parts come not from Sandler but the multiple celebrity cameos like Johnny Depp and Shaq. The first thirty minuets of the film contains so many jump cuts to different scenes that I thought something was wrong with the movie, conversations seem to end in the middle and we just move on to the next.

I watched this movie with my 14 year old twin nieces and there 8 year old sister, no one laughed. After awhile the older ones stuck there heads in there Ipads and zoned out for the rest of the film leaving me to watch the rest.

There is a reason this won so many Razzies and it deserved everyone of them. If you think about watching this film just bunch yourself in the face until you have a headache and you will have the same enjoyment and can avoid wasting your time.

review_title: Jack and Jill, More Like Crap and Nil
review_detailed_main: Being only 20 going on 21, I have been subjected to some good and bad Movies. I have seen well over 500 movies and this is one I want to erase from my memory completely.
