Unfunny, torturous and horrid, this makes Cabin Fever look like the Godfather and Bucky Larson look like Citizen Kane. I am an avid fan of B movies but this one doesn't even deserve to be treated as a "so bad it's good" kind of movie. Maybe it's because I grew up and found overuse of fart jokes and gag humor to be unfunny. It tries too hard to be funny and fails miserably. It's like Sandler took a dump on the script and said "write." Al Pachino's mildly homosexual performance didn't even make me smile. I've seen better movies on YouTube. If you are a fan of Sandler, this is a major pass. Disappointing and truly stupid, this movie puts stupid comedies to shame. Adam Sandler tries way too hard to be funny and truly fails. Do NOT believe all the good reviews as they were written by amateurs. It's an hour and a half of pure crap. I would rather watch a piece of paper burn than watch this movie again. And, for all you that were forcibly made to watch this or watched it, I am sorry. I rate it with zero stars as it deserves the lowest rating. I wish I could give it negative stars, but that would be impossible. Adam Sandler's worst career decision ever. As the soup Nazi would say, "no star for you!"

I am unashamedly Sandler biggest fan. If you were here to rate this movie so low then you were all here for the wrong reason. Why did you watch this movie at the first place? If you want an Oscar movies, you are so out of place. But, this is better than most Oscar movies (at least for me personally). This was a feel good movie that helps you in time of trouble. Sandler should be knighted for bringing so much joy to us movie audiences.

review_title: Funny, star-studded caper. Ignore the 3.4 rating!
review_detailed_main:
Whilst not the best film Adam Sandler has ever made, it's definitely not a 3.4/10 movie. I really enjoyed this and I didn't get bored once. It's got plenty of laugh out loud moments and lots of quirky humor pieces that Sandler normally throws in. The cast is great and the movie is really well put together. Anyone who rates this less than a 5/10 needs to get a sense of humor or be banned from leaving any more reviews on IMDb. This film doesn't take itself seriously, but you can tell that a lot of hard work and thought has been put into it. At one point Al Pacino was really struggling to keep a straight face which made the scene twice as funny. I loved that part.

I've seen many films that really deserve a 3/10 rating (unfortunately), but this ain't one of them, and that's why I decided to write this review. Heh heh heh! I've just finished watching it and I'm still chuckling to myself.

review_title: do i think it deserves the hate? no. do i like it? no
review_detailed_main: This is the worst Adam Sandler movie I have ever seen and i think everyone can agree with me, but its not as bad as everyone says it us. Too short too short too short.

review_title: A petrifying take on the morels of today's society.
review_detailed_main: Watch legendary actor Al Pacino face his demons (Adam Sandler) in this touching take on a man slowly losing his sanity. Early in the movie they show an advertisement for PeptoBismal trust me you're going to need some. You may question how a film like this was made just, take one good look around you and one day you will see how.

Why would they create this movie? I didn't enjoy it. The best part is Johnny Depp. BUT it is very quotable.

But don't watch it.

review_title: Let's Just Say Adam Sandler Is No Eddie Murphy.
review_detailed_main:
I recently wrote a review of God's Not Dead 1 and 2, admitting that I used to like them, but I realized over time how awful they are. Jack and Jill is another one of those movies.

Now, let me make this clear- I never LOVED this movie. But I did find it alright. I regret this wholeheartedly now, and let me tell you why, after I give you the plot summary:

In the movie, Adam Sandler plays Jack, a commercial director who's twin sister is coming home for Thanksgiving-but refuses to leave. The twin is also played by Sandler.

There are so many problems with Jack and Jill that it's kind of hard to know where to start, but here we go:

1. Adam Sandler playing a man and his sister? I don't mind cross dressing in movies-Eddie Murphy does this in The Nutty Professor movies and Norbit(Not a perfect movie by the way but still WAY better than this), and movies like Mrs. Doubtfire, Tootsie, and Some Like It Hot do this quite well, but Sandler just wasn't made for it.

2. His voice for Jill is quite annoying, worse than his voice for The Waterboy. I dare you look up a clip of this movie and tolerate Jill's voice. Now consider hearing it for a majority of a 90-ish minute movie!

3. There is SO much bathroom humor in this movie! There's literally a scene where Jill gets diarrhea on a date and at home she tells Jack about her horrible night in-between numerous farts and defecation sessions! In another scene, Baby Jill out-gasses Baby Jack in the bathtub!

4. It's a pointless movie. What are we supposed to gain from it? Laughs? A Thanksgiving movie? If you want either of those, see Planes, Trains, and Automobiles or Dutch, both great works from John Hughes. But please don't see this!

5. It's not that funny. There's a gag where Jill doesn't recall the name of It's A Wonderful Life, and it's predictable and not comedic. Fart jokes replace good jokes, and so much more. There's one decent joke where Jack dresses as Jill and his fake boobs are adjusted by a stranger but that scene doesn't amount to much in the end.

6. And if all of this isn't bad enough- AL PACINO, the same one that starred in The Godfather and Scarface, plays himself and becomes a LOVE INTEREST for Jill! That makes me speechless!

That's probably not every problem that this movie even has! How this was ever greenlit is beyond me.

I actually like Adam Sanlder. I enjoy Anger Management, Billy Madison, Happy Gilmore, Grown Ups, and a few others. This, however, should be collected and burned.

If you are blessed to have never seen Jack and Jill, remain that way. At most, see it to mock with your friends. Otherwise, there's no need to see it at all! It would be preferable to fall down a hill with a bucket of water than see this headache of a "movie" ever again.

Reverse Recommendations: If you want any good movie connected to this garbage, see any other great, good, or alright movie that I mentioned in the review, here they are again:

The Nutty Professor, Norbit, Mrs. Doubtfire, Tootsie, Some Like It Hot, Planes, Trains, and Automobiles, Dutch, It's A Wonderful Life, The Godfather, Scarface, Billy Madison, Happy Gilmore, Anger Management, or Grown Ups.

These 14 movies are all better, if not perfect, uses of your time!

Honestly, i don't get all he hate, Adam Sandler just proved he can play 2 characters at once and did amazingly well at it. I laughed for hours watching it even after repaying it for the 3rd time. Al paccino should have won an oscar. AMAZING

review_title: I gave this movie a shot, and deeply regretted it!
review_detailed_main:
When you decide to watch such a comedy movie the expectations are not high. But this one broke through the barriers of absent humor, not even in an entertaining way this "thing" is watchable.

The jokes aren't funny in ANY WAY, the plot is barely creative and the lines are easily predictable.

Sandler is practically signing his career end with this film (and carrying Pacino with him), even tho I really enjoyed some of his movies.

The only part that worth the laugh was both at beginning and ending, with real twins.

If you want to try this film, think two times.

review_title: Ha ha What a piece of.....
review_detailed_main:
I've heard people say this movie is a funny Sandler comedy, and i actually punch them in the face. Since grown ups, Adam Sandler's comedies and just becoming worse and worse. I guy can be funny like Happy Gilmore or Billy Madison. But Jack and Jill is just a stain on what is comedy. The film try's to be something more than it is creating awkward and very stupid situations throughout the film. Al Pacino stars as himself and some of the parts he is in made me smile, and that was about it. But the movie is just unfunny, providing lame jokes, slapstick comedy which only really works if used properly. If i was you, i will completely avoid this one. I walked out of the cinema and vomited in the trash outside and it still was not as disgustingly painful as having to watch this absolute garbage.

If Adam Sandler doesn't come up with something, i will just give up on him forever.

I'll admit, it's not one of his best movies but it's not as bad as everyone is making it seem.

I found it pretty funny and there are some quotes you'll find yourself repeating.

I've watched it around 6 or 7 times now and I'm sure I'll see it way more. It's a great movie to sit and laugh with the fam.

Forget what the other reviews say. This movie, a masterpiece. Watched this ten times and each time it got better. Adam Sandler, hilarious and extremely talented in maintaining duel identities in this movie. Al Pacino, truly found his place by ascending to godhood as Dunk Acino. The movie presents the best and worst qualities of humanity through Adam Sandler's character Jack who must realise past his selfish ways in using his sister Jill in order to help job and finds out the most important part of life is family. We get great cameos which have aged very well and incredible performances from actors putting in their A game this Mona Lisa of cinema will have you laughing, crying and wondering how you could be using your money for something. I'll tell you what to do, buy another copy and show it to as many friends as possible!

Don't believe the critics, see it for yourself and decide. Despite being warned I went to see this movie. Very typical Sandler Humor along the lines of Dumb and Dumber, but a little higher on the scatological scale. Not belly laughs, very predictable, clever at best, slapstick at worst. Most bits are funny.

What takes this to the next level is the performance of Al Pacino. The ongoing gag works and although a little redundant, it is over the top enough to make the movie worthwhile.

While it is certainly not in the same league as Animal House, Superbad, or Monty Python, it does not deserve the universal bashing it has received.

review_title: The film equivalent of a war crime
review_detailed_main:
Yet another abysmal effort from Adam Sandler. Does he genuinely not have anyone to tell him 'no'? He really needs someone to tell him when something isn't working, which let's face it is becoming more and more common. Maybe he just needs to check his massive ego and stop doing vehicles for himself and get some supporting roles, try to learn what funny means again, learn how to make a good film by watching others. I mean, what's next here, a feature length close-up of Sandler cracking 'jokes' to a hand puppet? Or maybe I shouldn't give him any ideas. IMDB really needs to add a zero rating, because giving it a '1' seems to indicate that I found something good about this.

This review has no spoilers, as the film itself is so rotten it can't be spoiled.

So, normally when I pay for a movie On Demand, I power through it even if it's bad.....not this movie.

I probably got about 30 minutes into it and it was just Adam Sandler doing the "oooooh, I'm Adam Sandler!" acting, that just never ended.

No plot. No witty dialogue. Nothing. This movie was built on a garbage script, if, indeed, it had a script at all.

In the first 30 minutes, the film went absolutely nowhere. It immediately jumps into the fact that the main character hates the sister, and does not have any more depth beyond him.

If you have a chance to watch this movie, spend that time working on a cure for cancer or cold fusion. At least you'll spend your time wisely over watching this abortion to American cinema.

I was working at a juvenile recovery center and was forced to take some of the clients to see this movie. Since I can't come up with five lines to describe how bad this movie is, I will just say the following: suck, suck. I hope Adam Sanders burns in he'll for this movie. SUCK, SUCK, plays both parts of brother and sister, both should have died at birth. SUCK,SUCK. Please stop making movies like this. Leaving the theater after the movie was over was the only highlight.

review_title: Not even worth the electronic words from my keyboard...
review_detailed_main:
I can't waste a whole lot of time on this movie. I like Adam Sandler, and have found him funny and entertaining in most of his previous films. I admit, I do know a lot of folks who don't like him at all. This movie will give them all the ammunition they need.

I tried to get through the entire movie, but just couldn't. I kept thinking, wishfully, it will get better. It has to. It will; it's Adam Sandler, for god's sake.

But it never did. Adam, what were you thinking? Did anyone read the script before they agreed to have any part of this horrible project? There was absolutely nothing funny in any fashion in the dialog. I never laughed, not even once.

I really can't believe how bad this movie was. And why anyone, any producer or anyone else who are professional movie makes, would put any money into this really, awful film.

review_title: Sandler's never been one for artistically brilliant movies, why would we expect this one to be any different?
review_detailed_main:
Adam Sandler is known for creating generic, box office garbage. Something to watch when there's nothing else on or something to put on in the background whilst you scroll through your laptop. His movies have always been light gags and ridiculous humour. Which is exactly why I don't understand how this one was attacked so much. Remember Bedtime stories? Or what about Little Nicky? They were much worse and yet Bedtime stories got more credit.

The point is that Sandler's movies are all the same and why should we expect any different? It's his style, as cancerous as it is to watch, he's made some good money off of it.

Now I'm not saying I like this movie but I think he's done worse. Al Paccino was in it. How in the world did he even get Al Paccino to be in it? Anyway, the gags are stupid, the jokes are stupid, the movie's stupid but it had it's moments that made me smile.

I thought I had seen some stinkers in my time but this wreaks to high heavens.All you can do is shake your head and ask how did this ever get onto film? there must be a trillion scripts going round Hollywood and they chose to make this turkey ,scriptwriters must be crying in their coffee. The celebs just keep on coming but it didn't help - Johnny Depp ,David Spade ,Christie Brinkley - and oh no- Al Pacino at the worst you've ever seen him.How could he have agreed to be in this utter mess ? Not the Godfather.It was like a nightmare that just kept coming.Adam Sandler as male and female twins , unfunny in both.Poor storyline ,not a feeble joke in sight even. I'd have been better putting my money towards new stage names for Adam Sandler and poor Al.If there was a less than one vote,I'd have given it. Don't waste your time or money !!

review_title: Is this Al's joke towards his fans?

review_detailed_main:
First of all, the movie is not as bad as people say it is. It's a light comedy you can watch to pass your time on a boring Sunday.

The dialog is not very well written and most of the scenes are not smart but you still can enjoy it.

The acting is fine. Not award-fine but fine. Sandler acted better than he had acted in other movies with better ratings. And if you prefer more "classical" actors, you have Al Pacino.

Well, most people will go and watch the movie for Pacino's shake and only. This is the only movie to have him play himself. It's a rare thing to watch an actor like him doing that. It's also rare to see him in a comedy.

Anyway, I think you shouldn't bash the movie before watching it.
The movie is amazing I love it. Funny, and family fun! Also great actors in the movie I definitely recommend you watch it on the weekend actually fantastic.

I had to see this being a huge sandler fan, despite the universal dismal reviews, below are the FAQ's that i will try to answer about jack and jill

1. Does it deserve IMDb 2.8 rating? No, it is not that bad, unfortunately it became the object of hatred for critics and public for no reason

2. Is it better than average sandler fares? Not as good as any sandler film till 2008, better than 'just go with it' (which i thought was the lamest sandler movie till date), as good as 'grown ups' may be

3. what doesn't work about this movie? the writing, the dialogues should have been more funnier, although its not totally lame, there are some funny lines in between and some physical comedy which saves the movie from a total fiasco.

4. How are the performances? Sandler is usual, shouting and screaming which will please his fans as usual, he looks pretty funny as jill and pulls out good physical comedy, Al pacino is a great actor make no mistake, but i felt that he was a miscast, he is too serious an actor to mock himself and because of that in his screen time the movie loses momentum over the humour, i felt that an actor of sandler brand like rob schnieder would have done justice to that role, Katie holmes is there for 15 minutes which is as good as a special appearance.

5. Is it going to be detrimental to sandler's career? No

overall i did not find this movie bad, it was entertaining in parts and sandler fans can watch it, The strength of the movie was its premise which i felt was one of the best ideas, i mean sandler playing his own twin sister made me laugh from the first go, but the ordinary writing stopped it from becoming a happy gilmore or a billy madison...

6/10...

review_title: Seeing Adam Sandler playing Jack and Jill and watching Al Pacino playing himself was both funny and a little cringe-inducing but it wasn't too embarrassing
review_detailed_main: I admit it, when I first saw the trailer of this movie, I cringed especially when that Indian kid hit Adam Sandler's Jill character during the Thanksgiving dinner scene. But having just seen the whole movie myself with my movie theatre-working friend, it wasn't as bad as I'd thought especially with the many cameos of Famous People that appeared throughout the film. And yes, Al Pacino himself didn't embarrass himself too much here. And I got a kick out of what happened between Sandler and Pacino during the near-ending scenes. I mean, I knew the latter wasn't going to get another Oscar nomination here but, really, he seems to be having fun and that was infectious. So on the whole, Jack and Jill was pretty good, if not great, and I had a good time despite myself having some eye rolling moments some of the times...

'JACK AND JILL': A Half a Star (Out of Five)

Adam Sandler for the majority of his career (in which he's been the most bankable star in Hollywood, for the majority of it) has consistently made crappy movies (with the exception of a few good ones like 'FUNNY PEOPLE', 'PUNCH-DRUNK LOVE' or 'HAPPY GILMORE' here and there) and they seem to be only getting worse. He certainly has never reached as low as he has with this film and I hope he can't go any lower. The funniest thing about it though is his films all (including this one) are huge box-office hits (except for the good ones, like the ones I mentioned). They all make over a $100 million a piece and huge profits. He's only making the films that people want to see, is what's the most ridiculous thing about it. Which proves that people love crappy movies. They may say they don't (and make fun of movies like this) but they keep getting made because people love handing over their money to see them.

In this one Adam Sandler plays identical twins Jack Sadelstein and Jill Sadelstein and the one joke premise revolves around the idea that Jack can't stand his annoying and grotesque sister when she comes to visit him and his family for the holidays each year. This time it turns in to an extended visit and Jack goes crazy trying to get rid of his sister. The craziest thing about the story is that Al Pacino plays himself as a crazed stalker who falls madly in love with Jill but Jill, despite always repelling men, isn't into the millionaire superstar. This drives Jack even crazier as he's been trying to secure a business deal with Mr. Pacino.

The movie is insane! It's one of the most painful experiences I've ever had watching a movie. The premise of the movie, in one effect, works because we as viewers experience fully how crazy Jack is going by having to put up with Jill but it's never funny. It's just disgusting and annoying. Sandler used to be funny and this is what he's seriously trying to pass as comedy these days. Honestly I don't seriously think he believes it's funny though. He knows it's crap but he knows that's what people want. He is a genius comedian but even more so he's a genius businessman and that's why he's the biggest star in Hollywood. He knows how to make a money making hit every single time. He produced the movie, wrote it (if you can call it that) with his buddies Steve Koran and Ben Zook, cast a bunch of his friends in it and hired his director friend Dennis Dugan (who directs most of his films) to direct. He made the movie for $79 million by allowing himself and his friends to pocket most of the money and put almost no effort into making a quality film because he knew it wouldn't matter. The studio still made a huge profit and everyone involved is happy. It seems the biggest joke is on all the viewers who paid to go and see it; Sandler is messing with everyone and getting richer and richer in the process. That's a genius comedian!

Watch our movie review show 'MOVIE TALK' at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ioQaCI5Qk34

"Jack and Jill" is another of the mass-produced, generic comedies that Adam Sandler has been putting out there recently. It doesn't really distinguish itself from so many others of his movies.

That being said, then the movie isn't necessarily bad, it is just an indistinguishable movie - a plain and stereotypical comedy that he has been making for quite some time now.

The story in "Jack and Jill" is about an odd pair of twins, where Jill loves Jack and will do just about anything to spend time together, while Jack is ashamed of Jill and tries hard to avoid her at all costs. Having to spend time together over the holidays, it becomes a period of hardship for Jack.

Story-wise, then "Jack and Jill" was alright, it didn't really bring anything new to the comedy genre, and it was all stuff that basically had been seen before in other movies. However, it did work out well enough and the story was entertaining from start to end.

As for laughs, well then there were a good amount of moments throughout the movie that causes laughter and smiles. I was thoroughly amused by many of the scenes in the movie.

The movie does have some good names to the cast list, but that doesn't necessarily elevate the movie out of mediocrity.

For a comedy, then "Jack and Jill" doesn't deliver all that it could have done, and that is a shame, because these types of comedies tend to be nice.

Every now and then I log on to IMDb and read a review that starts with 'the reason I joined IMDb was this film was so bad I had to tell everyone'. Well here I am saying the same thing. This film was so bad I joined IMDb so I could tell everybody. My main dislike regarding this films 'sheer awfulness', was the constant references to Judaism. Adam Sadler likes to remind us (every 3rd movie he releases)he is both Jewish and pro Israeli,Don't Mess With Zohan etc. Which is his business. But if the references in Jack And Jill were Christan or Muslim, the film would have rightly been sold as a Christian or Muslim 'comedy',instead Jack And Jill is trotted out as an Adam Sadler comedy. So disingenuous. Thank god I,unlike some unfortunate reviewers, downloaded it for free and watched it at home. Thank god for Bitcomet!

review_title: Had hoped this might have buried his career...
review_detailed_main:
I have recently had to think about what I considered the worst film I'd had the bad luck to pay to see but part from before it ended (it was Borat, and I lasted 20 minutes). But I had to think about those films that I had watched because 'others' wanted to see them and I was forced to watch to maintain healthy relations with the rest of my family. Strangely my wife seemed to go through a period of believing in the talent of Adam Sandler - strangely, because I have watched several of his efforts and have yet to recall even getting a smile out of this dolt, but then she has a habit of not understanding the concept of humour and, despite watching both apparent 'funnymen' Sandler and Will Ferrell attempts, does seem to come away very disappointed.

The funniest thing about this film was that it got made at all. Does nobody actually read Sandler's scripts or have the guts to ask him if he knows 'funny', or needs it explained to him? Seriously, had I watched this at a cinema I would have led a crowd back to the box office with flaming torches to demand our money back; luckily it was on TV, but it still rankles. All involved deserve to never work again. 0 out of anything - although I appear to have rated it one star?

I already knew after seeing the trailer for Jack and Jill (Dir. Dennis Dugan, 2012) that this film would not be a successful comedy, or even remotely funny. If you were one of these people, that presumed the same as me, then you were correct.

Early on in the film Jack Sadelstein (Adam Sandler) says that Al Pacino would never stoop as low as to star in a doughnut advert to promote a Dunkaccino. This for me was the funniest moment of the film as it was ironic that Pacino wouldn't stoop as low as a cheesy TV ad, but would actually stoop lower and star as himself in another dated and terrible Adam Sandler film. The plot in this film is very basic and follows the classic cause and effect narrative structure, like most comedies do.

Not only does Pacino sell himself out by appearing in this film, but he also sells out every other film he has ever made by rapping some of his most famous quotes from films like The Godfather Part II (Dir. Francis Ford Coppola, 1974) and Scarface (Dir. Brian De Palma, 1983) for the Dunkaccino TV advert.

Many of the gags in Jack and Jill are slapstick orientated, which is rarely funny in the best of films; especially when it is overused, which it was. Jack's twin sister Jill (Adam Sandler) would fall over so many times, expecting the audience to laugh because a man dressed as a woman tripped up or lifted up weights that even body builders couldn't. However slapstick gags were not the only form of comedy within Jack and Jill. I was also able to experience the "joy" of hundreds of fart jokes, which might appeal to the 10 year old target audience, but not to adults. Finally I was disgusted at the amount of Jewish jokes Sandler had incorporated into the film. I don't think anyone laughs at those jokes unless they are actually Jewish, and even then I couldn't be certain. The comedy aspects of the script felt like they were written ten to fifteen years ago and Sandler just thought we have the same expectations for comedy in 2012 as we did then. We don't.

Al Pacino is not the only star that appears as himself in Jack and Jill. Johnny Depp was also there with Pacino at a basketball game, and unusually Johnny Depp was probably the funniest part of the film. I will say that this film is seemingly aimed at American audiences rather than a British audience as Jack and Jill does have a lot of US celebrities that are unknown to me, and so the jokes they are involved in were just not funny.

I did smile a few times during Jack and Jill but I never laughed out loud, which I would expect to do when watching a comedy film. Unfortunately half the gags I may have laughed at are in the trailer and therefore are no longer funny when seeing them for a second or third time. For a film in the comedy genre, it failed. For a film in general, it failed. Do not watch this unless you love every movie Adam Sandler makes. If you do then this film is probably right up your street with its unintelligent comedy, pathetic attempts for a laugh and tedious narrative. I will leave this review with the simple question of: How does Adam Sandler always get such attractive wives in his movies, when he just isn't that funny?

If you enjoyed this review check out others on my blog: http://dalelawsonreviews.tumblr.com/

review_title: Bad.. but not as bad as reviewers claim
review_detailed_main:
In a nutshell, This movie was enjoyable to an extent; an appropriate view for young teens and adults alike. Jack and Jill does a superb job of providing a good laugh for all age audiences, the way this is done

is much like "Shrek" or "puss in boots" giving adults non-graphic, non explicit ADULT humor in ways only older audiences can perceive.

the movie does drag here and there, but somehow a pivotal scene moves the plot forward when things seem they have dug to deep into trying with this film.

nevertheless, I do not know if reviewers on IMDb have even watched this film completely; to me, it seems as if a person reads a few reviews about a particular film and decides to "go with" other peoples opinions without having ever watched it.

Bottom line, this film is at least worth a rent or a buy for a 5.00 bin DVD. and that's coming from a person who is not very drawn to comedy's.

I'm a big Adam Sandler fan, but I must say Jack and Jill is one of the worst movies I have ever seen. It was meant to be funny, but I hardly laughed. It was loud, obnoxious, and a waste of time. I think the problem is Adam playing is twin sister. I could not stand that screechy character at all! I'm disappointed because I really liked his other 2011 effort, Just Go With It.

Dennis Dugan's film is about a guy named Jack, who is a very good advertising executive. Unfortunately for him, he has to deal with his annoying twin sister for the holidays and get Al Pacino to appear in a commercial. Will her survive?

I don't understand how the great Al Pacino would fall for this tripe. He is a screen legend and should know better. That being said, he did deliver a strong performance. Adam Sandler, though tolerable as his manly self, was completely awful as Jill. He should not have done Jill the way he did because I never met such an annoying character.

Overall, this is the worst Adam Sandler movie I have seen to date. It was not funny and I spent the majority of the movie cringing whenever Jill was on screen. I guess the kids will enjoy this, but everyone else will find this torture. My "high" rating is due to the saving grace of Al Pacino. I rate this film 4/10.

Hands down this is a terrible movie. It plays on so many tropes, corny jokes, and crude humor. But if you stop trying to get any meaning or message from this movie, it becomes a fun watch of one of Hollywood's biggest flops. Especially when watching Al Pacino romantically, and quite aggressively, pursue Adam Sandler in a wig. It's embarrassing for everyone involved and that's what makes the film so funny.

What I mean by my title is that this is an Adam Sandler movie. The reviews of this movie seem to be based on the fact that they compare this to an intellectual comedy or something very popular like Hangover in terms of laughs. However I saw it as an adam sandler flick and got what i paid for. Adam sandlers very rarely get a good review. I mean on rotten tomatoes, this got a 4% rating while movies I LOVED like Click only got a 33%, movies like Grandmas Boy got only 18%, and Little nicky got 22%. If you like any of these movies a lot, go see it. I found it funny personally. Parts were boring and other parts were hilarious laugh out loud funny. Adam Sandler isn't going down in quality, its that he isn't changing. His movies are always stupid funny and full of slapstick humor which isn't a bad thing in my opinion. He does other movies like Punch Drunk Love, Rain on Me, and Click which are a break from the norm but most of his movies are generally the same. And equally bad in terms of reviews. So again for me i liked it. Funny at parts but don't compare to a critically acclaimed movie because you wont like it then. Compare it to something Adam Sandler has done in the last 5 years and if you liked them then this might be enjoyable.

I thought that it couldn't be as bad as the reviews said it was. I was wrong.

And it's not even "so bad it's good". It's just bad.

To make matters worse, Norm Macdonald turns up. I really like Norm's stuff, so it was disappointing to see him stoop so low for a pay check.

review_title: Not As Bad as all these other reviews claim!!
Jill is the only problem in this movie
review_detailed_main: The movie was pretty good with a lot of scenes that did make me laugh. There were some scenes who weren't funny but the majority of them were. The main problem with this movie and why it isn't getting a high score isn't because any of the jokes or the story but instead it's because of the main character Jill. In the whole movie Jill is an annoying character that will always get mad at Jack. Every time this happens it's her fault because she gets Jack mad and when he gets mad back she cry's and runs away while Jack is the one being blamed. Also Jill won't leave Jack's house and go back to her house even when Jack wants her to go. If this character had more time in the oven and fix these problems this movie would have been better. In conclusion, this movie would be better if Jill's character and personality was worked on more.
The Funniest part of this movie was when the end credits we're on the two twins and it goes like this: Twin 1:"Yeah we used to be triplet's" *Points to twin 2* Twin 1:"But then he ate him";)

I refer to the final scenes of this stinker. "Burn this! Destroy all copies! It must never be seen by anyone."

Truer words have rarely been spoken when it concerns Razzie Grand Slammer Jack and Jill. Though it has to be said, Pacino is in the singular funny scene in the movie, which is the rather humorous Richard 111 telephone scene. But everything else ... ??? What were they thinking?

This is just a terrible comedy and I'm not a serial Sandler hater. Tootsie and Mrs Doubtfire this is not. All the cleverness and fun of those two great films, is just buried under an avalanche of general stupidity and sweeping inanities.

It has to be said that Sandler may have had the last laugh. He's supposed to have been paid $20 million for his goofy twin performances and despite the critical derision, the world-wide Sandler diehards, ensured the movie ended up turning a reasonable profit. It frankly doesn't deserve to have done so.

review_title: What did I just see?!?? (Morbid curiosity got the best of me)
review_detailed_main:
Wow. Okay, this, regarded as Adam Sandler's worst movie ever, is one awful movie. It's actually amazing that this actually passed the idea stage.

I recently found myself rediscovering The Wedding Singer, which I liked still.

And I tried some other movies and they just aren't what they once were to me. But morbid curiosity got me to see this one; I figured maybe it's "so bad, it's good."

Um, no.

Nevermind all the product placement (though it's hard to ignore); what on Earth made Al Pacino do this movie?

Sandler stars as - you know the plot basically. He plays his sister. (Hard to watch) The jokes aren't funny; the gags about (ugh) "chimichanga bombs" was just so disgusting (why on Earth is this supposed to be funny? I'm surprised Sandler didn't make a comedy about how funny IBS is, or such).

So this is filled with flatulence jokes (nothing new there....) and with things like a kid, an adopted Hindu son, who you notice right away likes to stick things, tie things to him. Just completely bizarre. Adam Sandler does *not* deserve his wealth by any means.

This 91 minutes was just hard to stomach. Al Pacino bizarrely gives a reading like - well, like an actor basically, though this ain't The Godfather or And Justice For All..... One of the greatest actors lowering himself to be in this....

And when this movie aims for some kind of emotional, caring scene that might move you, it uses gibberish. The same kind of speech as Billy Madison at the dinner table, practically.

There is absolutely no reason for this movie to have ever been made, this is something that I'm sure a total Adam Sandler fan will at least want to see once (though many, and I mean many, big fans of his have stated that they usually love his movies but this is the worst - or one of the worst ones) - but this is something that you should try and avoid by all means...

If you're looking for a genuinely funny movie, I have to say this is not one, this just terrible, think about looking elsewhere, you may seriously regret having seen this - especially if you spent money on a rental or purchase.

Avoid. Don't let morbid curiosity get the best of you.

review_title: Not His Best But Not Bad
review_detailed_main: I think it's pretty funny even though he was pushing it pretty hard. The scene at the picnic could be considered stereotyping but they only pick certain things to cancel. And I really hope that was Bruce Jenner at the play lol!!

review_title: Jack and Jill is an absurd, yet pretty funny movie
review_detailed_main: I have seen many comedies with the same level of stupid humor as this movie, yet their reviews will be much higher. I don't understand it. This movie is funny and higher quality than most comedy movies anyway.

review_title: Not so bad and everybody laughing and laughing
review_detailed_main: I went to watch this film with my wife and daughter in Mexico with voices in Spanish language ("Mexican" exactly) and it's very funny the translation, i think it's for Eugenio Derbez (Felipe the Gardener) a Mexican comedian genius and for the twisted Mexican stereotype showed in the film that all the people in the cinema was laughing with every joke in this movie. I don't know why the critics destroy this funny movie? OK, will not in the 2012 Oscar's but 1:30hr of fun is guaranteed. Depp, Brinkley, McEnroe and others stars appears shortly, ones acting others in cameos. I don't like Pacino's performance and maybe was for the people who made his voice in Spanish.

review_title: It's pretty bad but not a complete disaster
review_detailed_main:
Jack and Jill is not a very good film, it is very silly and childish but I don't think it's the disaster people scream about. Unfortunately I've seen worse.

A person playing two roles has been done before and often good actors pull it off so that's not a criticism on its own. Sadly Sandler is not really pulling it off too well in this film and for that reason among many others this film is bad. It's plot was pretty thin but yes there was some plot that tried to put it together even if done badly. It managed to have some funny moments with Al Pacino's cameo and Jill being so absurd. Even in his worst films Sandler manages to make silly or stupid appear funny even if it is for a few moments. Katie Holmes was quite decent and seemed to be the only one carrying this wreck of a film. So overall and trying my best to be objective its a 5/10.

Some actors can pull off gender swap really well, Adam Sandler is not one of them. Every time Jill laughed I literally cringed, and unfortunately Jill laughed a lot in the film. There wasn't one funny joke in the movie, everything about it was irritating and cringe worthy.
I felt ashamed while watching this movie. It's so absurd, ridiculous and pitiful.

Easily, without a doubt, the least funny thing I've ever seen. My face has never been further from so much as a smile in my entire life. I'd say it's actually even less funny than Holmes and Watson, which is also completely humourless.

The character of Jill has to be one of the most unbearable, painfully obnoxious characters to ever exist in media. And they have the nerve to go for some 'emotional' family reunion scenes with this sad music as if you're supposed to feel something for this story!? The audacity of that was almost funny...

The only scene in the film worth watching is the 'Dunkacino' part, because it's so cringeworthy that it might make you laugh out of sheer awkward embarrassment. Apart from that, this is probably the worst 'comedy' I've ever seen.

I couldn't even get through 20 minutes of this movie. It was the most unbearable things I've seen. 20 minutes of my life I will never get back.

Jill is so unlikeable. She's unbearable. 1 Adam sandler is hard enough but 2 makes me want to shoot mysèlf.

review_title: Adam Sandler's salary could have fed a lot of people.
review_detailed_main:
I don't want to tear into this movie the way other people have but nor do I want to defend it partly because it's such an easy target.

You knew what you were getting, anyone who chose to watch this deserved what they got.

Crass, gross and unapologetic nonsense that thinks that somehow its message of standing by family will hold any water at all. It's just a fascinating mess like watching a rat king or something.

I'd sooner watch it than another generic horror movie.

Props to Al Pacino for doing it.
The movie is so bad but the 3 stars are for the last minute of the movie. The dunkacahino commercial at the end is comedy gold, just YouTube it rather than sit through the drivel.

OK. Yes, I agree that there is no incredible plot twist and you pretty much know what is coming. There is no deeper meaning to this movie. The cast is your typical Adam Sandler "Parade of Friends" cast. Sandler chooses to shove the fact that he is Jewish down the viewer's throat AGAIN.

But honestly, who watches Adam Sandler movies for their depth and originality?

There are some good, funny moments. Having Sandler play both male and female twins is funny. I know it's been done before and arguably better. However, with a smarter and more special effects savvy audience, I get the feeling they're just poking fun at the whole situation. He's just having fun with it. (I hope) They whole movie is stupid, anyway.

Do I think this is a good movie? Absolutely not. Would I pay to see it in theaters knowing what I know now? No. I could see myself watching this at home with friends, or a significant other. You get your chuckles out of Jack and Jill. That's all it's worth. Nothing more and nothing less. I think this is near the bottom of the Sandler Spectrum of movies. (which isn't really that high in comparison to other movies, to be honest) At least he does try to get some basic points across while providing laughs. I give it a 5. I didn't walk out screaming for my money back. I was smiling, but it was the stupid kind of smirky smile where I didn't grow as a person and wasn't really sucked into the plot or anything deep. I think the average rating here is too low, though.
One of Adam Sandlers worst movies and that's saying something. I watched it on the telly. The best bit was when they stopped the show and went to a breaking news broadcast.

review_title: I laughed! But boy was Al Pacino horrible
review_detailed_main: I don't know if it's just me but I thought this movie was pretty good. Adam Sandler did a great job with this film. Katie Holmes wasn't to bad and the kids were cute. Many cameos from many celebrities but other than that there was one horrible performance. Al Pacino. Someone had to say it. The plot was heart warming and I think that this is a movie that is fun for the whole family. I laughed a bit. But there is only one thing that doesn't make this movie all that great. Everyline that Al Pacino spoke had no sense of comedy. You could tell that he was trying to act but didn't succeed. I say that he is better for the original genre that he acts best with. Drama. I'm sorry but this is Pacino's all time low. All in all this was a cute family comedy that I would recommend to see.

There's a few hilarious moments in there, but if the highlight of the movie are the opening scene and end credits scene, it should give you an idea. The child actors were good too, they did well in their limited screen time.

review_title: If you are not an Adam Sandler fan, this film will not make you one

review_detailed_main: BEcAuSe HaViNg ThE tWo MaIn ChArAcTeRs Be ThE sAmE pErSoN iS a BrIlIaNt IdEa

review_title: Small laughs littered abundantly but an overall forgettable popcorn flick.
review_detailed_main: Jack & Jill, while slapshtick - literally, shtick - it still offered enough genuine laughs to be a funny, of the genre flick. It appears that Happy Madison, namely Adam Sandler really knows his comedy. If you're not a fan of his Mr. Deeds and his antics then you likely won't enjoy Sandler playing both titular roles, both male and female identical twins; but if you could manage to sit through 50 First Dates then you'll be in for a treat; Sandler reuses about 50 of his previous jokes to above average results. Overall, Jack & Jill is a solid big budget comedy headed up by a talented production team featuring a slew of winning cameos that you won't have to look hard to spot. Rent it, don't buy it. 5/10

review_title: Dunkacino! I knew it was you. Dunkacino!

review_detailed_main: After all these years I still crack up to this movie. I know it's hated by many. But it's a true family favorite.

i read many other reviews and thought i made a big mistake to rent this movie, but turned out to be a lot better and i actually laughed at many of the jokes. i mean, you can't go in with expectations up there with avatar or hang over. i actually found this movie quite fun to watch, a no brainer, just silly jokes like adam sandler's usual humor. twin sister, which is also played by adam, can be annoying, and some what gruesome to look at if you must dwell on it, but i must credit to his talents of playing dual roles. al pacino caught me a bit off guard though, could of carrying on the whole script w/o him. i recommend this movie for people who want to shrug off boat load of routine, and just want to kick back and laugh out loud on a Saturday night.

review_title: The Literal Worst Movie We Have Ever Seen
It is so bad, my mind erased it from memory
review_detailed_main: I am writing it in retrospect. Surfing through movie titles I stumbled across this thing. I watched it around 5 years ago with my gf, who loved this movie. To be honest never have been the fan of Sandler, but I admit there are good movies in his filmography. But not this one. You know, some movies are that stupid they are funny? This one is plain stupid. For me it was a torture watching it, I just did it for my gf as she clearly enjoyed it and wanted to watch it with me. At that time I wasn't movie afficionado and udually prefere japanese anime. Yet for me it was obvious the movie has nothing to do with parody or humor. It is just bad. Back then I gave it 5/10 which is "not good and not bad" (average) rating. But no.... I do not remember any, at least 1 funny scene, from this movie. It is aweful. Now I changed my rating to 1.
Watched it on Netflix on a night when I was not planning to do anything else and stumbled on this movie but if I were to pay for this in a hall, hell no!

review_title: Misunderstood it's not a serious Movie
review_detailed_main: It's not the best Adam sandler film , and it's not gonna win an Oscar but let's face it will any Adam sandler films win an Oscar. but it does have some funny scenes, an easy watch. Make your own mind up

review_title: Going to sound rude... but do I really have to explain anymore?
review_detailed_main: Adam Sandler doesn't even try anymore. He just wants a paycheck.

You should know what to expect from a "regular" Adam Sandler movie by now. And the people involved have that attitude towards the viewer too. The "we-know-you-know-we-only-play-pretend"! Wink wink! But is that enough fun for you? It's something that is tough to answer for any individual. I'm pretty sure I'd be laughing out loud if I was pre-teen watching this.

But even when it gets meta on you (Jack/Jill, you'll get it, when you watch it, if you watch it) it doesn't really work. So why and how did Al Pacino get involved? Everyone needs money, right? But he does give the whole thing gravitas. I still wasn't feeling anything particular, but he did deliver a speech towards the ending of the movie, that no one else in the cast could've made look as believable as him. And we're talking about some really messy phony message ... I wonder though how many boys/men will refer to this in the future as the beginning of a beautiful relationship ... to womens clothing!

review_title: I am a huge Sandler fan. I think he gets a bad rap. I think he's funny in almost everything. THIS MOVIE SUCKED! I say C-
review_detailed_main: "I love my sister, and I can keep my cool. It's just for four days." When Jill (Sandler) comes to visit her twin brother Jack (Sandler) for Thanksgiving he isn't happy. When days turn to weeks he gets more and more upset. After he finds out that his job is in jeopardy and they need Al Pacino to appear in a commercial for them Jack's only chance is for Jill to stay. I have liked almost all of Sandler's movies and I think he gets a bad rap for some of the things he does (much like Eddie Murphy), but I'm sorry Sandler...I can't back you up on this one. This one is almost as bad as what you have heard about it. There are a few parts that made me laugh, but when the best part is a little kid taping animals to his back that shows you what kind of movie this is. On a side note Al Pacino is my favorite actor of all time, but the last scene with him made me cringe...watch it and you will see what I mean. The only reason I kept watching was because of Pacino, but that scene almost made me regret it. Overall, a movie I can't really recommend..."Just Go With It" was much, much better. I give it a C-. It's only that high really because Pacino used a line from the "Godfather".

review_title: Al Pacino is in this film
Thank You Adam for the great laughs
review_detailed_main: OK, I totally loved this movie. I laughed hard and often, in fact I laughed more than probably any other Sandler flick except maybe the Waterboy. I know Sandlers humor has gone a bit out of style because there aren't dirty jokes, lots of cursing,lots of people getting drunk or stoned which is what people like now. It not that kind of humor, its pretty family friendly but man its hilarious to me...Adam is the latest Mel Brooks. I didn't actually think he was that funny as Jill but still there were so many funny moments. Adam will have to add dirty jokes, nudity, and lots of f bombs before he will get his audience back. Today's audience just can't get the old school slapstick humor anymore I guess. I feel lucky that I can get it and man I had fun. I needed the laughs too. Sandler is a comic genius, Im thankful we have him.

review_title: Jack and Jill don't get along.
review_detailed_main: This is an example of a film I watched without looking at the IMDb rating first. I was quite surprised to learn it had been rated so badly here actually.I believe this movie is not to be taken as seriously as some of the other reviews I have been reading, of which some are quite laughable by themselves. This is a typical example of a good Adam Sandler movie and reminded me slightly of his earlier work, such as the Waterboy. When the film began I felt like I wanted to watch this movie. It contained slapstick with good family humour. I especially loved the surprise appearances of celebrities in the film. It is a perfectly watchable movie. I give it 6 out of 10.

review_title: Feels like a poorly written SNL skit.
fun for the whole family. jack and Jill goes up a hill and never goes down

review_detailed_main:
Jack and Jill is amazing! I've always had a curious interest in heist related things. Like the real life heist at Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum where thieves got away with nearly $500 million dollars worth of paintings. So when it comes to movies I really like Ocean's Eleven both the original and remake. That is why I'm so amazed by Jack and Jill. The movie is terrible, absolutely painful to watch and I won't even go into detail cause they didn't bother putting any effort into making it, why should I care to give it a proper review.

No the reason I like this is because it's a heist movie. They received 80 million dollars to fund this movie, on top of that they had some painfully obvious product placement mainly for Dunkin Donuts and Pebto Bismol. So add even more money on to that 80 million. Now look at the production quality of the movie... how much do you think this movie actually cost to make? The actors are the most expensive thing in this movie. Not even the NBA scene where they went to a Lakers game... they didn't actually shoot a fake game they CGI the actors into a Laker's game. Why? Cause it was cheap as hell to CGI it.

So this movie barely cost anything to make... Adam Sandler doesn't even have convincing female body prosthetics. Jill is always wearing a lot of clothes to hide the fact that he probably just has socks in that bra. Just throw make-up on with a wig and do the nails. So how much did this movie actually cost? We'll never know the truth cause this was a scam. Grossed $150 million, budget $80 million + product placement. You didn't watch a movie you watched a heist, and they got away with it.

So the score? Well I'm amazed with this movie. I'm not making this score to get you to read this, I'm scoring this an 8 because as a heist, this was amazing. If you watched this you didn't see a movie, there's no conflict or plot, it's just fat people jokes and even a little racism too. No, what you just saw was a heist being done right before your very eyes.

review_title: I thought it was a joke
review_detailed_main:
I first heard about this movie when seeing an episode of "South Park" that referenced it. I seriously thought it was just something they made up! I didn't think that an idea this stupid could actually be real! So, the plot is that Jack's sister Jill is coming over for Thanksgiving. It's sad that there are so few Thanksgiving movies out there and this is one of the most well known. Anyway, Jack needs to get Al Pacino to do a Dunkin Donuts commercial for him.

As you might have guessed, Pacino falls in love with Jill. It's mostly because they both grew up in the Bronx. This is a pretty stupid reason to fall in love seeing as how Jill is ugly and annoying. We get even more hideous and embarrassing makeup throughout the film with David Spade as a woman and some old Mexican woman with one tooth who eats peppers. Jack has an adopted Indian son who likes taping things to his chest. This is stupid and pointless, much like the entire film.

In fact, the kid characters serve no purpose at all. We have to deal with Sandler's annoying voice as Jill throughout the whole film. Of course there's a lot of farts in this movie! Oh, and Jill pooping Mexican food. I think the only reason this didn't get a PG-13 rating is because there were no swear words in it. This won more Razzies than any film in history and while it's not as awful as "Daddy Day Camp" or "The Master Of Disguise", it's still horrendous. *

review_title: One scene makes movie worth a 5.0
review_detailed_main:
Overall this movie is not very good. It's somewhat painful to watch, but nowhere near the worst movie ever. It is, however, light-years from the best film ever.

Yet, there is one scene that makes this movie worth watching (up until that scene, at least). In the movie the son of Jack keeps scotch-taping items to himself. Even this semi-humorous aspect of the film wears out fairly quickly, BUT, BUT, BUT, before the humor is gone there is the scene with the mythical beast, the "Peppercorn."

The Peppercorn is easily a painful belly laugh--an intense focal point of funny that makes me give the film a five-star rating even if every other scene in the film warrants a zero. (And it just about does,...)

Sure we should expect low-brow from Sandler, but do we have to settle for encephalitis? Come on, Adam, you can do way better.

Rent this movie for a dollar from Redbox, watch the first fifteen minutes until the Peppercorn scene, laugh really hard, and then turn the film off. Thank me later.

review_title: Hard to go against the grid and say what hasn't already been said...
review_detailed_main:
This has to be the most product placement I've ever seen in a movie.

Distractions like that aside, Sandler hasn't changed much in the last decade and so, has he? Still thinks he's good at playing ridiculous comedy roles, whether a woman or whatever Hubie is in Hubie Halloween... it ain't good...

He's a good drama actor, and his stand-up is surprisingly good too, but things like that... uh, cringe...

review_title: Funny movie I love very cool and aeesome
review_detailed_main: This move was so good, I twerked! I love dunkaccino and the hijinx that ensue 10/10

review_title: Caramel swirl....I knew it was you....
Not necessarily bad because of its humor but more because of the way it's constructed.
review_detailed_main:
Honestly, with its comedy this movie is not any better or worse than the average modern genre attempt but the one thing that does make this movie worse is the entire way it got told and made.

The one thing with this movie that kept bugging me was that it felt like a couple of loose shot scenes, that weren't really connected by a story. It's like they went ahead and shot this movie before there even was a script ready. It's weird and it makes the movie feel like such an incomplete one.

But other than that, is the humor more lame or childish when compared to other similar genre movies? And is the Jill character really more obnoxious, irritating and unconvincing than any other forced comedy characters? Not really. As a matter of fact, the movie its humor and characters didn't bother me all that much. It's a comedy, so of course everything is being over-the-top. When you go along with that, it's not all that bad of a ride. It might even make you chuckle a couple of times.

One of the things that also really makes the movie worthwhile is Al Pacino as himself. You perhaps would expect his role to be no bigger than a cameo but as a matter of fact he is essential to the 'story' and you could even see he plays the second biggest and most important role out of the movie because Jack and Jill are both being played by the same actor, Adam Sandler, of course. And yes, Al Pacino was quite awesome in this. Most of the movie its best moments involve him and he plays his role very Pacino-like, so all serious and with all of his talents and skills.

It's really too bad he wasn't in a better movie than this one. None of the developments or backgrounds really work out for its story or any of its characters. Because of this also a lot of characters are making a very redundant impression in the movie, such as Jack's wife and kids. And his wife is actually being played by Katie Holmes but her role is hardly important at all for the movie.

It's far from the worst movie I have ever seen, it just is not a very well made one.

4/10

http://bobafett1138.blogspot.com/
I personally loved it. Very funny, very good story. Granted, it's definitely not the best Adam Sandler movie. But still a classic in my book.

Yes, I said it. Jack and Jill is not that bad. It does have a lot of dumb humor, but that what makes it funny. Yes, it does look a lot like a movie George Simmons (Adam Sandler's character from Funny People) would do. But, the reason why Sandler does films like this is because they make a lot of money, and when he does something different, those films don't do so well financially.

Sandler stars in both title roles. Jack is a television commercial director-producer, who dreads when his twin sister, Jill, visits for Thanksgiving every year. Jack has only a few weeks to land Al Pacino to do a commercial for Dunkin Donuts when Jill arrives. Jack now has to keep his cool knowing that Jill is not just staying through Thanksgiving, but even longer than that.

Sandler proves that he still is a funny guy in playing both parts. As Jack, Sandler has to play it straight and does good at playing the guy who has to keep his cool, yet loses it a few times. As Jill, he goes all out, especially with the ridiculous voice. Katie Holmes plays Jack's wife, Erin. She does okay with an underwritten part, but shows that she is not a great actress at all.

Al Pacino is a riot as he appears in the film as himself. He made a character out of himself as a guy who wants Jill, yet trying to stay professional as an actor.

Sandler fans, like myself, will enjoy seeing people such as Nick Swardson, Tim Meadows, Norm MacDonald, and David Spade appear in small roles. There are also cameos by Regis Philbin, Jared Fogle (Subway guy), and even Johnny Depp.

Something I found to be somewhat entertaining, yet unnecessary was in the beginning and end of the movies where quite a few sets of twins talk about being a twin and what it's like.

Fans of traditional Adam Sandler movies may find it entertaining, yet dumb. But that is what Adam Sandler movies are, and they still work.

review_title: Jack and Jill was not that bad
review_detailed_main: I watched Jack and Jill with my husband's family after Good Friday lunch. Now I must admit, this sort of film is not my cup of tea but I thought it was not at all that bad. We all had a good laugh and it kept us entertained for an hour and a half. I don't think it's meant to be taken seriously, it is a comedy after all and the fact that we saw Al Pacino, Johnny Depp and David Spade in it was well worth the effort. It had the usual toilet humor, farts, diarrhea and a sweaty bed but the cockatoo almost stole the show. I have seen films worse than this and I don't think it deserved the harsh criticism it has received. We all have someone in the family that we are embarrassed about and want to get rid of at times and this exaggerated the fact. I think Adam Sandler has a lot of talent and I don't think we've seen the best of him yet. I would love it if he tackled a really serious role, just to see what he is really made of.

Rating: 2.5 Overall, this may not be the worst movie ever made because it does have some moments and a 'memorable' performance from Al Pacino, but a majority of this movie is unwatchable and needs to be burned from existence.

Terrible Direction (Direction (The direction on a macroscale is incredibly formulaic and low-effort (similar to other Adam Sandler movies from this time period); the direction on a microscale is formulaic and tries very hard to get the comedy out in the movie; storytelling is templated and formulaic (similar to other Adam Sandler movies))), Bad to Pretty Bad Acting (Bad (from Adam Sandler (Pretty Bad from Jack because he's just playing the typical straight-man Adam Sandler character (who has his over-the-top moments); Very Bad from Jill because it is just so obnoxious and hard to sit through (burn all references to Jill in his filmography))), Pretty Bad (from Katie Holmes (Has ok chemistry with Sandler, but she does not do anything to make this performance memorable)), Decent (from Al Pacino (Plays Al Pacino but he is acting his ass off in some moments; he did not take any direction because it was obvious he did not want to be there)), Bad from the rest of the cast (from the rest of the cast (Typical Adam Sandler background characters; this does not count any child actors))), Terrible Story (Story (The concept is incredibly stupid; the plot structure is very formulaic and forced; character writing is very forced and shallow)), Very Bad Screenplay (Screenplay (The dialogue is low effort and similar to other Adam Sandler movies; the humor is not terrible because I will admit I did laugh at some moments, but it is very bad because the hit rate is like 1/8; the symbolism is shallow because it's a formulaic family message; the foreshadowing is a problem because this movie is too predictable)), Decent Score (Score), Terrible Cinematography (Cinematography (The frame rate was like off at some moments, there were too many cuts, and some of the scenes felt like they were from a multi-cam sitcom)), Terrible Editing (Editing (The cut felt very amateur and low effort; there were so many unnecessary cuts that it was very confusing)), Decent Sound (Sound), Terrible Visual Effects (Visual Effects (Very obvious and unnatural; clearly evident where the 79 million dollar budget went)), Terrible Animation (Visual Effects (Very obvious and unnatural; clearly evident where the 79 million dollar budget went)), Bad Makeup (Makeup (They just put drugstore makeup on the Sandman and called him a woman)), Makeup (They just put drugstore makeup on the Sandman and called him a woman), Pacing was decent because the movie followed the Sandler template, Climax is very predictable, Tone is very similar to other Sandler movies (just obnoxious comedy), There is no way this movie cost 79 million dollars to make.

It's fair to say that Adam Sandler's performance as both Jack and Jill in the dual role will not be joining the likes of Dr Strangelove in the list of best performances where an actor plays multiple roles. Despite this, I didn't find this quite as bad as expected. I had been meaning to see this for a long time and while it's pretty poor I have seen much worse.

I don't think the film's problem is its humour, I had a few laughs here and there and Sandler's antics were entertaining at times. It's very lowbrow and juvenile but I've watched far worse films on the comedy front. One of the main issues with the film is the fact that Jill is possibly the most annoying character in cinematic history. Jack isn't so bad, but Sandler portrayed Jill as a very irritating and unlikeable individual. The makeup also isn't great and you can tell that Jill is just Adam Sandler dressed up, whereas in films like Norbit (another much maligned comedy featuring a dual performance) it's hard to tell who's who. Elsewhere the acting performances are serviceable though nothing great, and Al Pacino features, strange to see him in a comedy. Another problem is that the film has the most obvious product placement in the history of film. It's like a 90 minute long ad.

Below average for sure, but it's not as bad as some make it out to be.

Another Adam Sandler movie that is funny. About Sandler's annoying twin sister is visiting him for what he thought was a few days turns into weeks. Really funny at times but overall not Sandler's best. Looking for a stupid laugh, take a look.

"Jack and Jill" (2011), well, that's 91 minutes I'll never get back. Wow, and I thought I'd seen bad films before. But this one takes bad to a whole new level! As soon as I saw the first trailer for this "film", I said to myself: "this movie is going to suck!" Sure enough, it did and it still does. This "film" is, by far, the worst Adam Sandler movie. "Jack and Jill" has an abysmal and cliched storyline, overall horrible acting, and a boring generic soundtrack to try and tie it all together. The plot is, a man named Jack Sadelstein is an ad executive. His sister Jill is coming to visit him and his family. Doesn't that just sound riveting? Yeah, I've seen this boring and overused trope a million times! It's just like hundreds of other films, an annoying family member comes to visit and cliched hijinks ensue. Granted, the majority of movies are recycled plot threads. However, the goal is to take the familiar concept and try to do it better while adding your own unique twist to it. "Jack and Jill" has none of that. To add salt to the wound, the character Jill is also played by Adam Sandler! We'll go into more details about that in a minute. Any way, it's about as cliched as you can get, just like most of Adam Sandler's other films. Bad jokes, toilet humor and subplots that go absolutely nowhere. That's right, for this entire 90 minutes, nothing of substance happens. Another thing, the writing is about as lazy as you can get. To ante up the irritation, Jill has a pet parrot that repeats the same phrase over and over again. It keeps screaming: "where were you?!" That's it, seriously, that's all it says and nothing else. Really? You couldn't come up with any other catchphrases? If you can't think of more than one thing for a parrot to say, then the stupid parrot shouldn't have been in the story to begin with! None of the characters are likable, even Al Pacino, who plays himself in this "film" couldn't save it. Yep, they somehow convinced Al Pacino to be in this "movie". I feel sorry for him! How did they get him to do it? Did they threaten him or his family? Any way, the story is cliched, the characters are cliched and the 91 minutes just feels like an eternity. As far as the acting goes, it's just as bad. This "film" has some of the worst acting I've ever seen, I'm serious. It's ironic that Al Pacino, who is such a fantastic actor, gives such a horrible performance here! But, the worst acting performance in this "movie" comes from Adam Sandler. When he plays Jack, he's boring. When he plays Jill, he's unbearably annoying! The sad thing is, that a lot of the actors and actresses here have acted better in other movies. What happened to them here? As far as the soundtrack goes, it's about as predictable as you can get. There's nothing in this "film" score that's worth writing home about. Now, what do you say we get to the only two good elements in this worthless pile of filth? The only two good things are the sets/locations and the special effects. All of the sets/locations are great and give this "film" a nice atmosphere. As far as the special effects go, all of them are well-done and still hold up to this day. Which is no surprise, seeing that this "movie" came out in 2011. "Jack and Jill" is easily the worst Adam Sandler movie, by far. I don't see how his career can possibly recover from this. Yes, I am aware that this "film" broke the record for winning the most Razzie awards. I didn't know about that until about a week ago! When I saw that it won those Razzies, I just cracked up. Frankly, I'm surprised it didn't win more than it did! Yes, I do think that this "movie" is that bad. I'm giving this "film" 2 out of 5 stars on my personal scale, which equates to 4 out of 10 IMDB stars. Must I tell you to stay away from this "movie"? Probably not, because anyone with a brain stem should know how bad it is. When I saw it, I had no choice at all. It was during an airport flight, and I was subjected to watching this piece of garbage. I couldn't avoid it, I was stuck! The tagline on the poster explains it perfectly in one statement; "it ain't pretty". At least they're being honest! Any way, for the sake of your decency, avoid "Jack and Jill" like the plague. The original nursery rhyme is much more entertaining!
Meh average movie about nothing it's really disappointing for Sandler.

review_title: A masterclass of so bad it's good
review_detailed_main: Don't get me wrong, the movie is horrible, but, it's my absolute favorite "so bad it's good" movie. Grab some friends and beer, and laugh hysterically at (not with) this movie. Make it a challenge to sip your beer for the duration of the "chimichanga scene." This movie is such a blast to make fun of that I ALMOST feel bad for the poor review. As a movie for bonding over its terribleness, it's a ten. It's also a great pallet cleanser if you've been watching too many great movies. Otherwise, a two is fair. The only reason it isn't a zero is because I think there was a joke at one point that made me slightly chuckle, but not ironically. My friends promptly started laughing at me. Anyway, this is probably the best movie to represent the Happy Madison dark age. It's a unique low for the studio, but in a way, an absolute high. It's a work of art in its own terrible way.

review_title: Has its moments far and few Inbetween

review_title: Thanks to Al Pacino for saving this boring movie !!!
review_detailed_main: Jack & Jill is an over-the-top comedy which is funny at parts but is surely a letdown. Jack is a happy-go-lucky family man with caring wife , beautiful kids and perfect job. His life turns topsy-turvy when his twin sister comes to visit them in the summer vacation. Jack & Jill , directed by Dennis Duncan , could have been better , funnier and probably more sensible like Sandler's previous which had at least some story to tell. Adam Sandler is not in form this time. He simply goes over the top and is sometimes irritating especially when he is playing the female character. The least I say for the direction , the better for you. The screenplay is terrible. The dialogues are passable. Adam Sandler do make you laugh at certain scenes but at one point of time , he just disappoints. God knows what Katie Holmes was doing in the film. The only silver lining was Al Pacino. The veteran actor has small role to play but he does justice to his part. Jack & Jill is watchable only in parts where as rest of the movie is just about OK. Average 2/5

review_title: fun premise but not his best
review_detailed_main: Wow... adam sandler scored bigtime, with co-star al pacino. Unfortunately, sandler works so hard on the twin comedy-bit, it's a whole lot of adam sandler. A fun story premise, but they hammer it so hard, it doesn't really work. Sandler plays twins jack and jill. Awesome opening song "I got you babe" by sonny and cher! When jack's twin sister jill comes to visit, she's more trouble than it's worth. When jill signs up for an online dating site, jack helps guys sign up. Co-stars katie holmes, norm macdonald, tim meadows. It's silly. And way over done. A funny bit when the bathroom attendant re-assures jack, when he dresses up in drag... which is redundant, at this point. Jill and pacino fight it out, in a strange scene. Can jack and jill make up and finally be friends?? Directed by dennis dugan, who directed a whole lot of sandler films. It's very just okay. Lots of writers, which may be part of the problem.

This iconoclastic piece of Western Civilization cinema is an unparalleled force of nature that struck the Hollywood scene over a decade ago, but still lives in my mind and heart likened to that fateful fall morning in New York City. Jill's story is a Shakespearean soliloquy wrapped in an enigma of mystery and tantalizing romanticism. Jack himself is a shallow charlatan and debutante who embodies the worst of Coastal elitism and corporate America. He forsakes any moral compass for the sake of social advancement. Poopsie, Jill's trademark fecal-inspired avian, presents the audience with an undercutting of Jill's credence as a protagonist, with his repeating of the phrase "Where were you?" suggesting a pattern of paralleling behavior between the namesake siblings: abandonment. I did, however, find myself to be greatly disappointed by Katie Holmes' nominal role in such a visceral plot for the audience, as I cannot even recall her character's name in the film. If she had channeled her acting prowess in the same vein as was done for her seminal role as the iconic former First Lady Jacqueline Kennedy in the hit television series, The Kennedys, which came out in 2011. For my foodies in the crowd, the Dunkachino, portrayed in the most commercialistic light of any plot object presented to the watcher in the movie, is presented as a bold, hazelnut-infused, daring take on the average American coffee, which Dunkin' runs on. In conclusion, Al Pacino was the best character lol, adam sandler a mf og watch this rn fam.

This movie is pretty decent, and I enjoyed it a lot. I really don't understand the consistently negative reviews. You know what to expect with Adam Sandler, so there's no point pretending.

But this film actually made me laugh a lot, and I also empathised with the characters. The chemistry between the actors, the energy of the film, and the story flow were all excellent. The plot does not hold any surprises, but I don't hold that against it -- it's a classic movie plot.

There are some really cheesy and cringe-worthy moments that I remember with a smile on my face. Think about it: There must be something to this movie that inspires such strength of feeling in so many reviewers... And it's not that it's "so bad it's good" -- it actually is good! I think some reviewers are in denial, feeling ashamed of themselves for secretly enjoying the cheesy humour.

It's actually better than some of his other movies, for example the acting in "Just Go With It" was much more stilted and awkward.

Jack and Jill is definitely worth a watch, if you enjoy Adam Sandler's humour.

review_title: Pretty bad acting and badly written, otherwise alright.
review_detailed_main: It's sort of a meh situation, being all kind of bland in a way (I'll let you to think about how). The acting wasn't great either, everyone's been asking how they talk to each other when they're both on screen, it's either played by the same character with a green screen and a voice actor or it's been done by two different guys, them both looking similar, it's most likely just an actor and the green screen though.

review_title: The best thing bout this movie? Put simply: it's Al Pacino!
The Worst Sandler Film I Have Seen.

review_detailed_main:
What was the purpose of this movie?

Certain people need to dress in drag to step up... Adam did it his way, exposing how cruel powerful men can be... One forced themself through this tale to understand how truly sad it is. Many are not as fortunate as Jill. Their innocence although annoying can be easily devoured and silenced by a greedy brother who can have her sacrificed and shut up for good, through submission.

Adam seems almost too careful in his slow build up in exposing powerful predators.... He seems to have tried to create a true to life morality tale based on the creepy underbelly of most high powered industries ... well... Many who live in the "real world" have seen/ experienced many a creepy greedy brother offer up their innocent sisters/ daughters/ wives in Sacrificial fashion when pressed for that extra dollar or bump up in stature for greedy powerful overlords.

Being naive at any age in the wrong place , one can be unknowingly offered up in a creepy awkward frightening position such as Jill. Most of us have been there in one way or another... Many don't need this reminder or morality tale.

This is a classic unspoken tale in which people who have survived through it do not share, if they get away unscathed.

Sandler exposes what happens in every industry.. tio clumsily... predators/prey... He shows hypocrisy is alive, what happens every day if one is fortunate to not have family.

Its a sad story, no one wants to re-live if they've ever experienced.

One wonders how many are fortunate enough for this 'happy ending'.

No thanks.

Worst film of the century. IDK WHAT TO SAY ABOUT THIS FILM.. I WAS SLEEPING. WHILE WATCHING.... I AM NOT PREFERING ANYONE TO SEE.. So plz don't watch this in theatres.. If it comes in ott platform u all can watch ur wish.. So this is what I wanna day.

It says a lot that this movie is this bad considering the cast and budget it had. It's almost like they put effort into failing. There's zero sense to the story and any of the lines/writing. Just all around bad.
I love most of Adam Sandler's movies but this was too painful to watch. Very disappointed!

review_title: Very very crazy good and so bad it's hilarious
