A very funny movie. The kind of movie that is so bad and the premise so stupid it cannot fail to be good. Adam Sandler in drag is such a convincing Jewish New York 80's Barry Manillow fan , and is so warm and attractive in a motherly way. IT IS SO WHACKY IT CANT FAIL TO BE FUNNY. Wonderful performances and such great fun to watch. The supporting cast are good, the lines so terrible they give you belly laughs. Al Pacino is brilliant, his love for Jill so full of pathos and tragedy and is played with such gusto and power it makes you shudder with delight, and impact what impact! Hilarious Hilarious! Hilarious!!!!

review_title: Not Adam's best, but not terrible!

I have never hated an Adam Sandler movie and I don't hate this one, it's not his best but there are some parts that you will giggle at. One bonus the movie has is that there are a TON of celebrities in it, including: Johnny Depp, Al Pacino, John McEnroe, David Spade, the Sham-Wow guy, Jared from Subway and many more. It is more of a family Adam Sandler movie so don't expect the same humor as in 'Happy Gilmore' or 'Billy Madison' if you do you will be disappointed. Just watch it with an open mind and remember that is more family humor that everyone will giggle at. I enjoyed it and it got some giggles out of me.

review_title: Keep up the good work Adam
review_detailed_main: Everything I expected and much more. Way to go Adam Sandler you have outdone your self again.

I had do much fun watching this film, I really loved it, Al pachino MADE this film hysterically funny, i swear i coughed a lung laughing!!! Why are there so many bad reviews? Has everyone lost their sense of humor? 

The first 15 minuets where not so funny, but gradually the film got better and better. It was so funny to see Al's character fall madly in love with ugly Jill! I was having a bad day and me and my friend went to this film, she was reluctant at first as she hates nonsense films but eventually agreed to see it, we both laugh our asses off, I cant remember the last time I enjoyed my self sooooo much! Thanx Adam Sander and thanx pachino, I will defiantly see this film again!

its not a good movie at least not good as typical Sandler movie, but its not so bad either, even, it should be watched to see comedy performance of Alpacino

"scarface,godfather acting on comedy" thats interesting, even in weak script like this.

i think Sandler should make movies like his older movies, these ones have good feeling inside. Jill character is kind of weird for Sandler's style,

i mean after lots of masculine characters in the past that he played, its not easy for audience to accept his role as a woman in a new comedy.

I don't care what anybody says... IT'S FUNNY.

Movie is funny, over-the-top, ridiculous and just a good laugh. Don't overthink it!

Obviously with Adam Sandler's connections with other high-profile athletes, actors and Friends. Movie makes for ridiculous and just funny.

Movie made me laugh. And I have no problem watching this movie over and over again. IT'S STUPID, yet heartfelt & mad.

Love Al Pacino's line at the end of the movie... How true could it be.

REMEMBER... Stop overthinking it, just enjoy it for stupid.

review_title: I'm on the fence about this movie
review_detailed_main:
Oh boy, here we go. "Jack and Jill", ugh i really don't want to write about this. But, here goes nothing.

Now, honestly its not as bad as i expected. The base plot is interesting, but the execution of it was poor. People saying that Adam Sandler is a bad actor, even though there may be SOME truth to that notion, i still choose to disagree with that. Sandler is a great actor, but the only thing pulling him back is the bad writing. Actors follow a script, they don't write that script, they just follow it. But this is a weird situation (for obvious reasons). The comedy is targeted towards the young audience. Sure, i chuckled a few times and the plot was good enough.

Honestly, this is a movie for children and not for anyone above the age of 16.

What are these people saying? This movie was one of the funniest movies I've ever seen! I have to admit that is a kids movie but when I went to the theater on 11/23/11 it was totally packed! All throughout the movie all I could hear from the audience is complete laughter! At one point I my self was laughing so hard that I had stopped breathing and I fell out of my chair. All these F's on ratings must just be because all these people are jellos of the director! I'm not going to give anything away, but when the movie gets to the Mexican Festival, be prepared for non-stop laughter! If your having a hard time deciding to see it, wait til it comes out on DVD... I totally recommend this movie!

review_title: Watch It For Al Pacino & Adam Sandler!
review_detailed_main:
'Jack and Jill' works primarily for 2 reasons: Al Pacino & Adam Sandler. Pacino pitches in a Fantastic, Unforgettable Performance, while Sandler takes up 2-roles, and delivers a really sporty & relaxed performance.

'Jack and Jill' Synopsis: Family guy Jack Sadelstein prepares for the annual event he dreads: the Thanksgiving visit of his twin sister, the needy and passive-aggressive Jill, who then refuses to leave.

As a film, 'Jack and Jill' will work for those who love over-the-top comedies. Its strictly NOT meant for the pseudo intellectuals, who only have an appetite for Hardcore-Serious Cinema. I won't say I loved this comedy, but I definitely didn't hate it either. Come on, you're not meant to take this film seriously, its meant to make you laugh, that's it!

Ben Zook, Steve Koren & Robert Smigel's Screenplay is over-the-top, but funny at times nevertheless. Dennis Dugan's Direction, is fair. Cinematography, Editing & Art Design, are functional.

Pacino is truly Unforgettable in here. The Emperor of Acting delivers a load of laughs, thanks to his Fantastic Comic-Timing & Undeniably Screen-Presence. Sandler, on the other-hand, delivers a very relaxed & sporty performance. He's good as Jack & completely "fun" as Jill. Among other performances, Katie Holmes is her usual self. In cameo roles, Johnny Depp & Shaquille O'Neal are Superb.

On the whole, 'Jack and Jill' is funny in parts. Watch it for Pacino & Sandler's Winning Performances.
Adams movies arent always that funny but this movie has been better than his recent comedies. I personally found it goofy as hell!!!

review_title: Sandler's films are jewels and Pachino shines
review_detailed_main: Adam's films are a perfect gateway to forget the world and have a load of fun! Like others, this one's also full of heart and laughs. Loved how Jill seemed like such a different character, from Jack. Kudos to Sandler for pulling that off. Pachino's flexing some real comedy muscles in this one.

I like Adam Sandler. I love his films. But this was such a disappointment. I was expecting a lot from this film as I would with any Sandler film, but it didn't deliver. Now, granted, it's decent. There is two or three funny bits in it, but overall it's not on level with any of his other films.

On a side note, Al Pacino was very good. I love that man in anything he's in and he makes a very funny advertisement for a new drink at the end which got some film quotes in there, which was nicely done.

So, the film is defiantly Sandler's worst, but not as bad as everyone claims it to be as there was a few funny bits (most from Pacino though.)

As an avid movie lover, some of my favorite comedy treasures have resulted from watching the movie blind without having read the reviews or watched a preview beforehand.

For example, The Royal Tenebaums, Raising Arizona, Young Frankenstein and Lost in Translation note some of the highly-rated comedies that remain perennial favorites of mine and ones that I have enjoyed over multiple viewings.

Yet, other comedies that have been panned by critics have also hit the right note with me. Among those are Mixed Nuts, The Waterboy, The Hot Chick and now Jack and Jill. I could do without a few scenes of the bathroom/gas humor, but the laughs far outweigh those minor episodes.

Adam Sandler convincingly portrays his twin sister with hilarious and touching results. The special effects are so realistic that honestly I'm not sure what was real and what was CGI, especially Poopsie the cockatoo or cockatiel. The sight gags are hysterically funny.

The sole fact that Al Pacino plays a prominent role in this movie should garner a higher rating and he does it with serious panache. Even Katie Holmes gives a wonderfully straight performance as Adam Sandler's wife.

The addition of Sandler buddies Nick Swardson and Alan Covert provides some hilarious support. The cameos are so numerous that you just have to watch and enjoy - David Spade is an absolute hoot.

Finally, the real twins that bookend the movie are adorable and funny. I just don't understand how someone could not appreciate this movie and avoid laughing their heads off!!!

RIP Norm Funbucket.

I'm just giving it a 10 just to balance it out, because I think 3.5 is pretty low, I mean c'mon. If you're a fan like I am of Sandler, you gotta support every movie he's in just for the sheer enjoyment I get of seeing him on screen, whether he's part of a good script or not. No homo. I just love his personality, and him as a person, so it's hard to hate on any of his movies, and I gotta say even though it's scores under most his other movies, I still enjoyed watching it.

Although it's not a movie I would put in the blu ray player to watch, when deciding on a movie, but if it's on TV like one of the movie channels, I'd leave it on, just cuz I love Sandler, and the way his films look, aesthetically, are nice. Always colorful and saturated it seems, and filmed somewhere beautiful.

review_title: Not Great, But Not One of the Worst
review_detailed_main:
I personally found this movie to be average. While not every joke hit home for me, there were a few that made me laugh every now and again. Adam Sandler may not be great in drag, but he gave an alright duel performance. The story and characters were not too strong, but that's not why we watch Adam Sandler films.

My biggest problem is how over hated this movie is. I hear so many people calling it both one of the worst comedies and one of the worst overall movies ever made. I say, is it really "one of the worst" bad? I would understand some hate, but "one of the worst ever"? I don't think that's warranted at all.

Seen this film a few times. Can't understand the bad reviews. Laughs all round. Double Sandler!!! What can be wrong?? Laugh a minute! If anyone else was cast as his sister, it would just be wrong. Loved it.

review_title: Even more fun a second time
review_detailed_main: Goofy movies like this can really be a hit or miss. I really enjoyed watching this again. It made me laugh quite often. I liked Adam Sandler playing Jill. There's a lot of silliness, but that's what I was in the mood for. I always enjoy the little parts of the actors added in. They are just great! I bet everyone had fun in the creation and the making of this movie. If you don't like other Adam Sandler movies, you most likely won't enjoy this. That's OK. Not everything is everyone's cup of tea.

review_title: An ideal premise for Sandler (and Sandler fans)

review_detailed_main:
Adam Sandler plays a young father that lives with his kids.

Then the man meets his twin sister.

But then disasters strike as the twin sister is around.

The climax is on a tropical cruise ship.

There are some cameos along here.

Like Al Pacino and his silly fake beard.

Be prepared for some silly antics along the way from here.

Beside some stupidity there are at least some heart.

But it's not the worst movie I ever seen.

At least Adam Sandler saved it all with Hotel Transylvania.

6/10

review_title: Not the worst movie out there
review_detailed_main:
Is this Sandler's best film? No. Is it his worst? In my opinion, no. That award goes to Punch Drunk Love. So take my review with a grain of salt if you loved that flick.

This movie is fun, and funny. If you loved any of Sandler's CD's from back in the day Jill's voice won't sound unfamiliar. It's actually quite comforting to be reminded of the 90's Sandler again.

I am not sure what other reviewers were expecting for this flick, but it's a pretty typical Sandler flick to me. I swear I feel like sometimes online something catches fire (like hating this flick), and everyone just runs with it.

Anyway, if you have the time in your life to waste on any Adam Sandler flick this one doesn't disappoint if you aren't expecting Shakespeare or something utterly intellectual.

This movie has plenty of laughs but it has some things that you are unlikely to be willing to sit through. The problems are these:

1. Adam Sandlers female counterpart is plain offensive to women and I think the Jewish? In a way that is uncomfortable.

2. Adam Sandler's acting talking to himself is naturally not fluid. It is uncomfortable.

3. A lot of supposed humour comes from horribly prejudice comments made by the characters. Such that even if you thought you'd sit down and watch a bad movie... continuing with the viewing would make you feel wrong and uncomfortable.

That said I got through this movie and found some random cut away type jokes quite funny. It doesn't stop it being awkward but I do have one thought about how you could enjoy this film better... Well making a comedy that is just offensive is discomforting but we can all see what archetypal movie we're going for here. What if this film was actually just that movie made as a serious drama with a few jokes thrown in there, but the main characters are really portrayed so badly that the serious story turns to uncomfortable character jokes? If you can view it through these eyes where there is a shallow but sensitive story being told about 2 awful human beings that learn to stop being hateful to each other and everyone else, and try to forgive that it is framed as an all out comedy, enjoying only the side-comedy for laughs... Then you might make it to the end without feeling dirty. Maybe. Good luck though!

review_title: Cute if you don't mind trash
Not a good movie but I still loved it
review_detailed_main:
Is this movie as funny as other Adam Sandler movies? No, it is not.

Is this Al Pacino's best performance? No, it is not.

However I gave this movie a 7/10 rating.

For starters, I went into this with low expectations.

There were a lot of stupid parts to this movie, but it struck a special chord with me. It was the portrayal of a brother who cannot stand his sister. Nobody else can understand his feelings and his frustration. It reminds me of my own sister. This is a frustration that I share.

I also think the part where Jill leaves a "sweat angel" on the bed when she sleeps is a piece of overlooked comedy gold.
The first time I saw this incredible film I couldn't stop laughing. This is a modern masterpiece

review_detailed_main: This movie imo is great, has a great message about family, has his Regular actors he only puts in his movies, great coloring, funny jokes, Cool Al Pacino, Cute supporting wife, and Adam plays 2 of the main characters, that is HARD, requires a lot of editing too, had some cool cgi, pretty scenes, the whole movie had it's theme, had a lot of holidays, big budget, and more, I'm not going to lie to yall, this movie is STUPID, but at the same time, this is what it's meant to be, there is still a message about family at the end, still good actors and acting, still imo funny jokes, and I watched so many Adam sandler movies, all of his best tbh, and this can maybe even be top 10, stupid kinda movie, weird script and weird characters, so that is why it's a 6/10 For me.

Addam Sandler is good actor. He make funny film. I laufgh so hard I soil muyself.

All people should see Addam Sandler movie Jill and Jack. It is best movie every made. It will win osscar for best movie and Addam Sandler will be honnered with much riches and fame.

I just want to say that I think Addam Sandler is funnest person ever and that everone must see Jill and Jack more then once time.

review_title: Meant for kids. Not for critics.
review_detailed_main: While this movie is pretty bad... it's honestly one I enjoy watching every once in a while. Definitely not bad enough to be bottom 100 movies. But if you're with kids they're going to think this is hilarious. And isn't that really the point of a PG movie??

review_title: What is wrong with you people
review_detailed_main: This movie is typical Adam humor with good laughs and your basic comedy entertainment. I mean if you don't like Adam why even watch it. If you do like him it's pretty funny. You folks need to head over to Walmart and grab a sense of humor.
I laughed about 50x. Idea might be dumb, it's not masterpiece theater hello it's Adam Sandler.

review_title: an amazing and fun movie to watch !
review_detailed_main:
if you've seen the trailer you know that you are not going to see anything complicated or academy awards worthy.

i also watched ' A Very Harold & Kumar 3D Christmas' and for the rating of 7.0 it got it was horrible which made me assume people just like dark humor and sex jokes which are not even funny...

well 'Jack & Jill' is family friendly and had me laughing at many points unlike many other films.

i don't like Adam and i don't like most of his films but this one was awesome and i actually like the way he played in drag.

go watch it!

I know what your thinking, Really? BUT if you knew my mother and how dead on this movie is you'd love it too. I am not sure who Adam Sandler wrote the part of Jill based on because it IS MY MOM. My Mom was just visiting for Thanksgiving, Jill wears the same clothes, says the same things and also travels with enough luggage to supply a small army. Just replace her pet with a small dog she HAS to travel with.

This movie is what get me through the Holiday and what makes me be able to laugh at all the crazy stuff my Mom does without losing it.

Thank you to the writers! I just wish this would have done better at the box office. My children laugh like crazy when they watch it!

I don't understand why people so didn't like this movie! I liked it! Of course, it was gross but it was grossly portraying some truths. I love it shows how girls can be more rude than boys for instead.

And I found it funny the boy who tapes things on him. Especially the pepper.

I loved also to see Pacino.

And I think this movie subtly, maybe too subtly, was showing how stupid it is to criticize a celebrity for showing some emotion. It made me think of the big scandal made of Tom Cruise's couch event, which was certainly a natural demonstration of emotion, and that many many people mocked, apparently without any consideration of hurting the feelings of Tom Cruise.

There are many things that make me think that this movie speaks a bit about the Cruise life : the word "cruise" used, the conversion of Erin - Katie Holmes in the movie - to the religion of Jack, ...

Bye. And why be so harsh? Oh and also I loved the little scenes in the beginning and the end of the movie. At the end, I especially loved when it was a little girl speaking about how her brother could put her back on her feet when she'd fall and feel bad.

Very kind.

Love, Leila

review_title: Hilarious! Don't listen to the bad reviews ;)
review_detailed_main: If you love Adam Sandler's humour, you will love this! It's not an oscar winning movie but it does its job! I absolutely loved this movie. I don't understand the harsh reviews, what did people expect? It is supposed to be a ´stupid' and hilarious movie and not an oscar winning movie. I found it a bit similar to White Chicks ;) Also, we get to see Johnny Depp and Al Pacino! I spent a really good timen! Thank you Adam Sandler!
I don't understand all the hate for this movie. It's got a great storyline and is so freaking funny. I laughed so much at this movie that my stomach hurt.

This is a typical Adam Sandler comedy, just the way I love it. Crazy, stupid, heart warming and very funny. The low ratings are not fair at all and definitively does not mirror the true value of this flick. And this is the main reason why I felt I just had to write a review for this movie. If you like Adam Sandler movies, you will like this one too indeed... but most of all if you like Al Pacino you will love this movie. He is great and so funny. I just love actors who can make fun of his own image and Pacino does it like the master he always is. Also Johnny Depp and other cameos invite you for some nice laughter. if Sandler is your cup of tea, then this one won't disappoint. I loved it!
I don't see how people don't like this movie it's funny as heck. Adam Sandler is amazingly talented. This movie is well made and well written.

My husband and our teenage niece went out to see this movie together. At first, we were concerned about the television commercials showing the entire flick, but then we were pleasantly surprised. I personally found myself laughing throughout the movie. While Adam Sandler had a great performance, for me it was Al Pacino who stole the show with his over the top antics. Sadly to say there were some things that were very implausible, but even these items did not distract too much from the movie itself. Jack and Jill is a feel-good movie that is supposed to make you laugh and have a great time. It delivers in that area. Of course if you are looking for something deep and moving with Oscar-winning performances, then you should be looking for something more like J. Edgar.

The movie was a bit slow in the very beginning, but later I forgot that it was slow because all the people in the cinema were laughing.

I just love watching Adam Sandler movies, he's movies are fun and enjoyable, and this one was fun too, liked the story, Jill was the most funny part in the movie I just don't understand why some people didn't like it. Just because it was decent to watch that doesn't mean its not funny. Me and my friends we loved it.Some scenes made me laugh so much that i got tears in my eyes. If you are free and you just wanna laugh then this is a cool one.

If you liked (Grown Ups) and (Just Go With It) then you have to watch this!!! I would love to have this one in my DVD collection, because it can be watched more than one time.

If you watched the movie and u didn't like it then Just Go With It.................

review_title: What Is Wrong with Everyone - This Movie Rules!
By Far the Best in the Last 10 Years!
review_detailed_main: This moving was pretty amazing. I've had this feeling before during family get together and to see it put to comedy was pretty funny. At times Adam says to his sister what we all wish we could say to crazy family members. I laughed through out the whole entire film. From beginning to end! I didn't think this was going to be a funny movie at all. Adam as a woman? But it worked and he made a pretty woman at that. Scary. It reminded me a lot of Robin Williams comedy. The cameo's the stars it was a very well done movie. The only thing I didn't like was Katie Holmes part, it should have had a bit more action on her part. She was almost there only for show. Still an excellent film.
I honestly loved this film the pure talent in writing, acting and cinematography is amazing! Hopefully a sequel will come out soon I've seen many others wishing the same too! :D Jk

review_title: One of the best films this year!
review_detailed_main:
This movie is so amazing and funny, I nearly cried because it was so funny. Dennis Dugan has made a work making this film. I feel amazed and astonished because I haven't seen so many great films this year.

I love how Adam Sandler plays both his roles, man and women. He really takes it funny with the role of Jill, and Jack (how he gets so annoyed with Jill). I sat there in the theater (when it was finished), hoping there would be more to it.

This was so much better than any of these movies: Abduction, The Big Year, Harry PotterVII, and The Smurfs.

I recommend you watch this movie, even if you're not into comedy films. It is a good use of money because the whole family will laugh. I hope they make a remake to this, because I would be first in line to see it.

review_title: Laughing hard at all your one star reviews
review_detailed_main:
Possible spoilers?

Honestly, I think you all need to lighten up. I expected nothing from this film, watched it as I like Pacino. Ended up crying with laughter, I don't ever remember laughing so much at a film.

To the people leaving comments like...'are we meant to believe Adam Sandler as a woman!?".....NO! It's just him in a dress, that's why it's funny.

To the people leaving reviews like "does Pacino need the money?"....NO. Quite obviously not, he's clearly just having fun and being silly with a fun crowd.

Are you telling me there's NOTHING funny about Al Pacino getting himself mixed up with Harvey Keitel, or falling in love and lying on the sweat shadow, or doing an advert for Dunking Donuts?? REALLY?

Or the kid taping things to himself? Or the grandma being revived with jalapeños?

Honestly, I'm genuinely surprised at these reviews. I'm still laughing at the film, and how badly you guys seemed to have missed the point.

HYSTERICAL!

Al Pacino was amazing! No offense to those who hated it, but it really is a SMART comedy (in the vein of Tropic Thunder). I've seen it twice in the theater. Pacino's last clip is PRICELESS! The trailer doesn't do this film justice at all... the good stuff is all a surprise. It isn't a movie about taking in a homeless man for Thanksgiving... that's just one small scene. Having some knowledge of cinema should help you enjoy this film. (Just for reference, I have a graduate degree from USC, I'm over 30 and female). LOVED IT! LOVED IT! LOVED IT! The laughter in the theater here in Monterey was loud, so clearly it's not the one-star film some of these reviewers have said. Yes, Adam Sandler doesn't make an attractive woman... he's not supposed to be pretty! There are 'family moments' that made us cringe... but that was the point. Who doesn't have someone in their family that's not the star? Funny stuff!

review_title: Embodiment of the Renaissance of Cinema
review_detailed_main: Jack and Jill is a phenomenal piece about identity and how we deal with our identities. It speaks to the basic tenets in our heart, that despite our family members, we will always in the end love them. This brilliant film highlights this idea in quality dialogue, with great directing and writing. All of our world's social situations, whether they are troubling or beneficiary, are displayed in this film, all the while having witty humor that can make the sternest of the stern chuckle with glee. The comedic factor of this statement about the human psyche really does a great job of not keeping the overall statement drown the audience in boredom. I would like to start this review by stating my disappointment that it was not a big screen adaptation of the classic nursery rhyme. Took me half an hour to work that out. But once I did, I realised that this was a fantastic film, the high-brow sort of comedy we have all come to expect from Adam Sandler.The man has set the bar extremely high this time, might be hard to top this one. But I do hope he does. My only real concern is for Al Pacinos mental health. This man is deeply disturbed, I mean he played a bizarre parody of himself. It was almost as if he were portraying an amalgamation of every single character he has ever played on screen in his long and illustrious career.

All in all a quality film, marred somewhat by the casting of Katie Holmes as Jacks wife Erin. I say this only because she is not a high quality actress, certainly not in the same echelon of say, a Bridgette Wilson or a Fairuza Balk. These are capable actresses of a high calibre. I actually believe that Adam Sandler would have been able to play a third character. Why stop at two? He could play Jack, Jill and Erin. Any more than that is ridiculous, Eddie Murphy territory.

Katie Holmes incompetence as an actress is almost as deplorable as her incompetence as a wife. Perhaps this film was the catalyst for her divorce from the great Tom Cruise. Did she not ask him permission? Did he feel threatened by her amazing chemistry with Adam Sandler? Or was Adam Sandlers superiorority the only thing threatening Tom?

In summary, a feel good romp the whole family will enjoy.

Unless your family supports terrorism.

review_title: So Bad, It was meant to be Bad....

I am glad I watched this movie after it was panned to death. I knew and hoped it would be as bad as I expected. I wanted to watch a bad movie to absolutely tear apart a piece of mainstream cinematic crap. Oh, how I love to tear apart a movie. I relish the actual hatred I can achieve at ruining 2 hours of my time. I look forward to blaming others for my choice at being gullible enough to waste money with some kind of mindless irrelevance. I love to hate meaningless (and worthless) productivity.

I screwed up on this one.

I was so ready to eat this movie alive. Chew, spit, chew, chew, spit and spit. But it became clear that this movie was meant to be bad. Not as bad as "Plan Nine from Outer Space". That was inadvertently bad. J and J is worse. Worse in a good way. "PNFOS" had no A-List stars. This is full of stars. Full of stars in a "Mad,Mad,Mad,Mad,World" kind of way. To see so many stars of this era come together for such a piece of crap is breathtaking. This will become one of the greatest failure/triumphs of Hollywood-ego/having-fun kind of movies ever.

If only the Three Stooges were still alive.
Al Pacino gives his greatest performance of his career in this film. Alongside the various other cameos by great comedic legends, especially Shaq. Wonderful film, I love Al Pacino and dunkin donuts.

As the movie progresses you find that the relationship between Jill and Al Pacino was well thought out and well written. Adam Sandler's characters in this movie are very charming and funny. The amazing acting, direction and writing are all what makes this movie Al Pacino's and Adam Sandler's best movie.

review_title: Funny. Sandler delivers his usual brand of comedy.

He overdid it when it came to that but otherwise, I thought the movie was great. The character of Jill is funny, vulnerable and yes...kind of creepy but she's supposed to be! I'm the type who will view a movie just for the enjoyment of. If it entertains, that's what matters. I don't view it worried about lighting, music selections or similar nitpicking critiques as someone who fancies themselves a Siskel and Ebert successor might do, nor do I feel it's worthless unless it teaches a lesson or seeks to reinforce an agenda. If you're that type as well....someone who just wants to be entertained without the need to dissect the picture to look for discrepancies, then you should enjoy this movie as well.

Jack is a successful businessman with a lovely home and family. It seems the only thorn in his side is his annoying sister, Jill, who comes annually to visit for the holidays. Adam plays both characters well in a way anyone with that type of dynamic with their own sibling can relate too.

As Jill Adam does display some crude humor that only a guy who is masquerading as a female could pull off, as any actual female who produced those scenes would either gain sympathy or disgust from the audience. (imagine Katie Holmes performing some of Jill's raunchier scenes and you'll get my drift). And Jill comes across as incredibly annoying at times, but to be honest that's perfectly okay because that is what Sandler was going for in the character and, frankly, what anyone who has a toxic individual in their family such as Jill could easily relate to.

The next time you're at home for a couple of hours and need a simple, silly distraction from a serious world, push Play on this movie. You'll be glad you did.

Honestly I was afraid....a lot. Being a huge Sandler's fan, I didn't want to witness yet another faliure... I'm so happy I didn't read IMDb reviews before! I was very nicely surprised. C'mon guys, it is soo far from 3,5...Not long ago I watched That's my boy. I didn't like it... I love most of Sandler's stuff, Big Daddy, or even Click (different genre though).

Al Pacino was a little weird but not hideous. Time to time he happened to be even funny. Yes, the taping kid was a little overacted (but sorry, I just couldn't help thinking: THIS IS THE KID OF USA, americanized poor Indian kid, doing whatever he wants to do. So I appreciated some self- irony there by Sandler, which he can do so nicely so often). It may have the charms of Spanglish. But overall the dialogues were GOOD, jokes flied here and there - somewhere lower somewhere higher.

The biggest compliment I can say is that I forgot MY world around....which is lately my biggest issue, films rarely happen to do the trick, to completely engage me and make me forget about my poor life for 1,5-2 hours. This movie jumped the bar.

My biggest criticism though: I can really see that throughout the movie Sandler was struggling when talking "for himself", the parts when he was talking with Jill, it was shot alone....I felt those parts artificial and not believable.

As a single woman - getting older and older - I could relate to the poor Jill, net dating...feeling lonely....I have been there. That part was really nicely done. What I appreciated, too, as usual the minor characters - as his assistant e.g. - were enjoyable, as well, great lines for them.

I gave 9 .... but I admit it was because of my shock - I expected so much worse after seeing the trailer (I have been delaying watching the movie for so long). It is worth probably something like 6-7, but hey, I'm a true fan! Have fun....

review_title: oh come on!!!,,,,,,its great, lots of laughs and no swearing!!
review_detailed_main: I can't believe all the negative cynical comments about a rather clever slapstick comedy similar to the type of movie which made Laurel and Hardy very famous all those years ago! It was great entertainment, funny, cleverly done with all aspects of interest for the viewer:- Animal antics, slapstick moments, clever dialogue and a family movie for all to watch together. There was even some moral messages; cant understand the comment about it having racial motives??!!!! The onslaught of negative comments have me entirely confused?! The story of twins, one a success the other not and getting together with all the family dynamics and comedy which follows, makes it a very funny with many moments of big smiles! Adam Sandler pulls off the movie well with Katie Holms doing a great 'straight' part as Adam's wife. The aspects of the children's 'oddities' was just part of the fun. The part of Adam's character twin sister was also played by Adam and was believable albeit she had masculine tendencies!!! Al Pacino was good as the besotted hopeful boyfriend of Adam's twin sister. All in all I feel this movie is well worth the watch, leaves you with a smile on your face and laughter in your heart - cant be bad! p.s. whats wrong with some toilet humour anyway, makes me laugh and much much less offensive than the torrent of foul language other movies expose us too.

review_title: A lot of laughs despite a deeply flawed dual-role concept and execution
review_detailed_main:
I've never been a big Adam Sandler fan. I have difficulty identifying with or empathizing with the characters he portrays and generally don't find the subject matter of his films particularly interesting or compelling. I can't even remember much from the Sandler films I've seen, other than Jessica Biel undressing in "I Now Pronounce You Chuck & Larry" and the pineapple gag from "Little Nicky." But the good thing about this is that I was able to watch "Anger Management" a second time without feeling that I had heard the jokes before.

I didn't expect to enjoy "Jack and Jill" in the least, but found myself laughing aloud quite often. Al Pacino is hilarious and there are some amusing cameos. Many of the supporting roles are well developed and Sandler is confident enough to work with talented co-stars and allow them to take some of the best lines, even in a bit with an actor complaining that a puppet in a Pepto-Bismol commercial has the better lines. Some of the physical comedy gags are a riot, particularly one in a weight room, one concerning a restroom valet and some of the dance steps. The denouement with Pacino is priceless.

This is not really a comedy about a successful man who must endure an annual visit by his uncouth, unsophisticated, uneducated passive-aggressive twin sister. It's a movie about a man who must learn to accept his fraternal twin who is very much alike him physically but very much different emotionally and intellectually, and whom everybody else seems to like despite the flaws that annoy him.

The dual Jack/Jill role is good for a couple of laughs and contributes to the theme of the movie, but also gives the movie an underlying creepiness that grated against my deeply ingrained homophobic tendencies. A common movie trope involves a character who cross- dresses and must fend off unwanted advances from suitors of the same sex and/or manage to pursue a love interest of the opposite sex while pretending to be the same sex, all for comedic effect. Here we have a male actor in the role of a female who attracts two ardent suitors. As the audience is acutely aware of the Crying-Game undertone, some of the scenes seem a bit creepy and test the limits of credulity. Jill is abrasive, physically unattractive and about as sexually appealing as the hand puppet seen in the Pepto-Bismol commercial.

Personally, I think the movie would have been much better without the dual role and with a female actress playing Jill. Sandler was never convincing as a female and I never believed the interest or fascination of the two suitors.

review_title: Don't listen to the hate reviews, this movie is hilarious!
review_detailed_main: As the summary says, don't listen to the hate reviews or the rating, this movie is hilarious. The humor in the movie is great, and anyone a fan of the hot chick, scary movie series, mean girls, the house bunny, and austin powers will probably enjoy what this movie has to offer. People have been saying that this is one of the worst movies Adam Sandler has ever written and starred in, I STRONGLY disagree. My family and I laughed through out the hole movie, and a picnic seen far into the movie had me and my grandmother in tears from laughing so hard. The movie starts off with Adam Sandlers' character Jack trying to make a great commercial for pepto bismal, and with his twin sister Jill arriving soon, more pressure is added to everything. There are many great scenes in this movie that even thinking back on them I burst out laughing. Even if you aren't a fan of twisted comedy that is not for children, the stars that are in this movie are worth seeing, such as Katie Holmes, Al Pacino, Adam Sandler(of course), Regis Philbin, Drew Carrey, and a brief appearance of David Spade at the end of the movie. All and all, Jack and Jill is completely worth your time if you are into this type of comedy, you may just find yourself laughing so hard you cant breathe!
